translated: They describe an offense entailing confession as one that is not to be confessed. … They describe an offense that is not to be confessed as one entailing confession.

original: anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya deva manussāna
translated: They are practicing for the harm of many people, for the unhappiness of many people, for the ruin of many people, for the harm, unhappiness, and ruin of gods and humans.

original: Bahuñca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū apuññaṁ pasavanti, te cimaṁ saddhammaṁ antaradhāpentī”ti.
analyzed: bahum ca te bhikkhave bhikkhū apuññam pasavanti te ca imam saddhammaṃ antaradhāpenti iti
translated: They will make much demerit and they will cause this true teaching to disappear.”

original: Dasamaṁ.
analyzed: dasama
translated: The tenth.🔽🔽

original: “Ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū anāpattiṁ anāpattīti dīpenti te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bahujanahitāya paṭipannā bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: ye te bhikkhave bhikkhū anāpattim anāpatti iti dīpenti te bhikkhave bhikkhū bahu jana hitāya paṭipannāḥ bahu jana sukhāya bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussāna
translated: “Those who explain what isn’t an offense as not an offense, they’re acting for the welfare of many people, for the happiness of many people, for the good, welfare, and happiness of many people, of gods and humans.

original: Bahuñca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū puññaṁ pasavanti, te cimaṁ saddhammaṁ ṭhapentī”ti.
analyzed: bahuñca te bhikkhave bhikkhū puññam pasavanti te ca imam saddhammaṃ ṭhapenti iti
translated: They generate much merit and they support this true teaching.”

original: Ekādasamaṁ.
analyzed: ekādasama
translated: The eleventh.

original: “Ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū āpattiṁ āpattīti dīpenti te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bahujanahitāya paṭipannā bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: ye te bhikkhave bhikkhū āpattim āpatti iti dīpenti te bhikkhave bhikkhū bahu jana hitāya paṭipannāḥ bahu jana sukhāya bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussāna
translated: “Those who explain an offense as an offense, they’re acting for the welfare of many people, for the happiness of many people, for the good, welfare, and happiness of many people, of gods and humans.

original: Bahuñca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū puññaṁ pasavanti, te cimaṁ saddhammaṁ ṭhapentī”ti.
analyzed: bahuñca te bhikkhave bhikkhū puññam pasavanti te ca imam saddhammaṃ ṭhapenti iti
translated: They generate much merit and they support this true teaching.”

original: Dvādasamaṁ.
analyzed: dvādasama
translated: The twelfth.

original: “Ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū lahukaṁ āpattiṁ lahukā āpattīti dīpenti … garukaṁ āpattiṁ
analyzed: ye te bhikkhave bhikkhū lahukam āpattim lahukā āpatti iti dīpenti garukam āpatti
translated: “Those who explain a light offense as a light offense … a heavy offense as a heavy offense …

original: garukā āpattīti dīpenti … duṭṭhullaṁ āpattiṁ duṭṭhullā āpattīti dīpenti … aduṭṭhullaṁ
analyzed: garukā āpatti iti dīpenti duṭṭhullam āpattim duṭṭhullā āpatti iti dīpenti a duṭṭhulla
translated: they describe a heavy offense as heavy … they describe a grave offense as grave … they describe a minor offense as minor …

original: āpattiṁ aduṭṭhullā āpattīti dīpenti … sāvasesaṁ āpattiṁ sāvasesā āpattīti dīpenti🔽… anavasesaṁ āpattiṁ anavasesā āpattīti dīpenti … sappaṭikammaṁ āpattiṁ sappaṭikammā
analyzed: āpattim aduṭṭhullā āpatti iti dīpenti sa avasesam āpattim sa avasesā āpatti iti dīpenti  anavasesam āpattim anavasesā āpatti iti dīpenti sa paṭikammam āpattim sa paṭikammā
translated: they make known a grave offense as a grave offense … they make known a serious offense as a serious offense … they make known a non-serious offense as a non-serious offense …

original: āpattīti dīpenti … appaṭikammaṁ āpattiṁ appaṭikammā āpattīti dīpenti;
analyzed: āpatti iti dīpenti appaṭikammam āpattim appaṭikammā āpatti iti dīpenti
translated: they make known an offense entailing confession as an offense entailing confession … they make known an offense that is not entailing confession as an offense that is not entailing confession;

original: te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bahujanahitāya paṭipannā bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: te bhikkhave bhikkhū bahu jana hitāya paṭipannāḥ bahu jana sukhāya bahunaḥ janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussāna
translated: they are practicing for the welfare of many people, for the happiness of many people, for the good, welfare, and happiness of many people, of devas and human beings.

original: Bahuñca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū puññaṁ pasavanti, te cimaṁ saddhammaṁ ṭhapentī”ti.
analyzed: bahuñca te bhikkhave bhikkhū puññam pasavanti te ca imam saddhammaṃ ṭhapenti iti
translated: They generate much merit and they support this true teaching.”

original: Vīsatimaṁ.
analyzed: vīsatima
translated: The twentieth.

original: Anāpattivaggo dvādasamo.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 1
analyzed: anāpatti vaggaḥ dvādasamaḥ  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The twelfth sub-chapter on no offense is finished.🔽The Anguttara Nikāya

original: 13. Ekapuggalavagga
analyzed: eka puggala vagga
translated: The chapter on one person

original: “Ekapuggalo, bhikkhave, loke uppajjamāno uppajjati bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: eka puggalaḥ bhikkhave loke uppajjamānaḥ uppajjati bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussāna
translated: “Monks, there is one person who arises in the world for the welfare of many people, for the happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, for the good, welfare, and happiness of devas and humans.

original: Katamo ekapuggalo?
analyzed: katamaḥ eka puggalaḥ
translated: Who is that one person?

original: Tathāgato arahaṁ sammāsambuddho.
analyzed: tathāgataḥ araham sammāsambuddhaḥ
translated: It’s the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.

original: Ayaṁ kho, bhikkhave, ekapuggalo loke uppajjamāno uppajjati bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho bhikkhave eka puggalaḥ loke uppajjamānaḥ uppajjati bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussānam ti
translated: This is that one person who arises in the world for the welfare of many people, for the happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, for the good, welfare, and happiness of devas and humans.”

original: “Ekapuggalassa, bhikkhave, pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmiṁ.
analyzed: eka puggalassa bhikkhave pātubhāvaḥ dullabhaḥ lokasmi
translated: “Monks, the manifestation of one person is rare in the world.

original: Katamassa ekapuggalassa?
analyzed: katamassa eka puggalassa
translated: Who is that one person?

original: Tathāgatassa arahato sammāsambuddhassa.
analyzed: tathāgatassa arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.

original: Imassa kho, bhikkhave, ekapuggalassa pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmin”ti.
analyzed: imassa kho bhikkhave eka puggalassa pātubhāvaḥ dullabhaḥ lokasmin ti
translated: This is that one person whose manifestation is rare in the world.”

original: “Ekapuggalo, bhikkhave, loke uppajjamāno uppajjati acchariyamanusso.
analyzed: eka puggalaḥ bhikkhave loke uppajjamānaḥ uppajjati acchariya manussaḥ
translated: “Monks, there is one person who arises in the world as a marvel.

original: Katamo ekapuggalo?
analyzed: katamaḥ eka puggalaḥ
translated: Who is that one person?

original: Tathāgato arahaṁ sammāsambuddho.
analyzed: tathāgataḥ araham sammāsambuddhaḥ
translated: It’s the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.

original: Ayaṁ kho, bhikkhave, ekapuggalo loke uppajjamāno uppajjati acchariyamanusso”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho bhikkhave eka puggalaḥ loke uppajjamānaḥ uppajjati acchariya manussaḥ ti
translated: This is the one person who appears in the world for the benefit of many people, for the happiness of many people, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of devas and human beings.”

original: “Ekapuggalassa, bhikkhave, kālakiriyā bahuno janassa anutappā hoti.
analyzed: eka puggalassa bhikkhave kālakiriyā bahunaḥ janassa anutappā hoti
translated: “The passing away of one person, monks, is lamented by many people.

original: Katamassa ekapuggalassa?
analyzed: katamassa eka puggalassa
translated: Who is that one person?

original: Tathāgatassa arahato sammāsambuddhassa.
analyzed: tathāgatassa arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: The Tathāgata, monks, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: Imassa kho, bhikkhave, ekapuggalassa kālakiriyā bahuno janassa anutappā hotī”ti.
analyzed: imassa kho bhikkhave eka puggalassa kālakiriyā bahunaḥ janassa anutappā hoti iti
translated: The passing away of this one person is lamented by many people.”

original: “Ekapuggalo, bhikkhave, loke uppajjamāno uppajjati adutiyo asahāyo appaṭimo appaṭisamo appaṭibhāgo appaṭipuggalo asamo asamasamo dvipadānaṁ aggo.
analyzed: eka puggalaḥ bhikkhave loke uppajjamānaḥ uppajjati adutiyaḥ asahāyaḥ appaṭimaḥ appaṭisamaḥ appaṭibhāgaḥ appaṭipuggalaḥ asamaḥ asamasamaḥ dvi padānam aggaḥ
translated: “Monks, there is one person who appears in the world without a peer, without equal, without counterpart, without match, without parallel, without simile, without compare, the foremost of bipeds.

original: Katamo ekapuggalo?
analyzed: katamaḥ eka puggalaḥ
translated: Who is that one person?

original: Tathāgato arahaṁ sammāsambuddho.
analyzed: tathāgataḥ araham sammāsambuddhaḥ
translated: The Tathāgata, monks, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: Ayaṁ kho, bhikkhave, ekapuggalo loke uppajjamāno uppajjati adutiyo asahāyo appaṭimo appaṭisamo appaṭibhāgo appaṭipuggalo asamo asamasamo dvipadānaṁ aggo”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho bhikkhave eka puggalaḥ loke uppajjamānaḥ uppajjati adutiyaḥ asahāyaḥ appaṭimaḥ appaṭisamaḥ appaṭibhāgaḥ appaṭipuggalaḥ asamaḥ asamasamaḥ dvipadānam aggaḥ ti
translated: This is the one person who appears in the world without a peer, without equal, without counterpart, without match, without parallel, without simile, without compare, the foremost of bipeds.”

original: “Ekapuggalassa, bhikkhave, pātubhāvā mahato cakkhussa pātubhāvo hoti, mahato ālokassa
analyzed: eka puggalassa bhikkhave pātubhāvā mahataḥ cakkhussa pātubhāvaḥ hoti mahataḥ ālokassa
translated: “With the manifestation of one person, bhikkhus, great vision becomes manifest, great light,

original: pātubhāvo hoti, mahato obhāsassa pātubhāvo hoti, channaṁ anuttariyānaṁ pātubhāvo🔽hoti, catunnaṁ paṭisambhidānaṁ sacchikiriyā hoti, anekadhātupaṭivedho hoti, nānādhātupaṭivedho🔽hoti, vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyā hoti, sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyā hoti, sakadāgāmiphalasacchikiriyā
analyzed: pātubhāvaḥ hoti mahataḥ obhāsassa pātubhāvaḥ hoti channam an uttariyānam pātubhāvaḥ  hoti catunnam paṭisambhidānam sacchikiriyā hoti aneka dhātu paṭivedhaḥ hoti nānā dhātu paṭivedhaḥ  hoti vijjā vimutti phala sacchikiriyā hoti sotāpatti phala sacchikiriyā hoti sakadāgāmi phala sacchikiriyā
translated: “With the appearance in the world of one person, great vision arises, great light arises, great radiance arises, the appearance of the unsurpassed knowledge & vision of the Dhamma arises, the realization of the unsurpassed knowledge & vision of the Dhamma arises, the appearance of the unsurpassed knowledge & vision of the Dhamma in the world arises.

original: hoti, anāgāmiphalasacchikiriyā hoti, arahattaphalasacchikiriyā hoti.
analyzed: hoti anāgāmi phala sacchikiriyā hoti arahatta phala sacchikiriyā hoti
translated: “The realization of the four analytical knowledges arises, the penetration of the various elements arises, the penetration of the component of insight arises, the realization of the fruit of knowledge & freedom arises, the realization of the fruit of stream entry arises, the realization of the fruit of once-returning arises, the realization of the fruit of non-returning arises, the realization of the fruit of arahantship arises.

original: Katamassa ekapuggalassa?
analyzed: katamassa eka puggalassa
translated: “Whose appearance is this?

original: Tathāgatassa arahato sammāsambuddhassa.🔽Imassa kho, bhikkhave, ekapuggalassa pātubhāvā mahato cakkhussa pātubhāvo hoti, mahato
analyzed: tathāgatassa arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa  imassa kho bhikkhave eka puggalassa pātubhāvā mahataḥ cakkhussa pātubhāvaḥ hoti mahataḥ
translated: The Tathāgata, worthy & rightly self-awakened.

original: ālokassa pātubhāvo hoti, mahato obhāsassa pātubhāvo hoti, channaṁ anuttariyānaṁ pātubhāvo
analyzed: ālokassa pātubhāvaḥ hoti mahataḥ obhāsassa pātubhāvaḥ hoti channam an uttariyānam pātubhāvaḥ
translated: With the appearance in the world of one person, great vision arises, great light arises, great radiance arises, the appearance of the unsurpassed knowledge & vision of the Dhamma arises, the realization of the unsurpassed knowledge & vision of the Dhamma arises, the appearance of the unsurpassed knowledge & vision of the Dhamma in the world arises.

original: hoti, catunnaṁ paṭisambhidānaṁ sacchikiriyā hoti, anekadhātupaṭivedho hoti, nānādhātupaṭivedho
analyzed: hoti catunnam paṭisambhidānam sacchikiriyā hoti aneka dhātu paṭivedhaḥ hoti nānā dhātu paṭivedhaḥ
translated: the realization of the four analytical knowledges, the penetration of various elements, the penetration of elements,

original: hoti, vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyā hoti, sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyā hoti, sakadāgāmiphalasacchikiriyā
analyzed: hoti vijjā vimutti phala sacchikiriyā hoti sotāpatti phala sacchikiriyā hoti sakadāgāmi phala sacchikiriyā
translated: the realization of the fruit of knowledge and freedom, the realization of the fruit of stream entry, the realization of the fruit of once-returning,

original: hoti, anāgāmiphalasacchikiriyā hoti, arahattaphalasacchikiriyā hotī”ti.
analyzed: hoti anāgāmi phala sacchikiriyā hoti arahatta phala sacchikiriyā hoti iti
translated: the realization of the fruit of non-returning, and the realization of the fruit of perfection.”

original: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekapuggalampi samanupassāmi yo evaṁ tathāgatena anuttaraṁ dhammacakkaṁ pavattitaṁ sammadeva anuppavatteti yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, sāriputto.
analyzed: na aha bhikkhave aññam eka puggalam pi samanupassāmi yaḥ evam tathāgatena anuttaram dhammacakkam pavattitam sammat eva bhikkhave sāriputto
translated: “Bhikkhus, I do not see even one other person who expounds the Dhamma in accordance with the true Dhamma as well as the Venerable Sariputta does.

original: Sāriputto, bhikkhave, tathāgatena anuttaraṁ dhammacakkaṁ pavattitaṁ sammadeva anuppavattetī”ti.
analyzed: sāriputto bhikkhave tathāgatena anuttaram dhammacakkam pavattitam sammat eva anuppavatteti iti
translated: The Venerable Sariputta expounds the Dhamma in accordance with the true Dhamma.”

original: Ekapuggalavaggo terasamo.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 1
analyzed: eka puggala vaggo terasamaḥ  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The thirteenth chapter on the single person is finished.🔽The Book of the Tens

original: 14. Paṭhamavagga
analyzed: paṭhama vagga
translated: 1. The First Chapter

original: “Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ rattaññūnaṁ yadidaṁ aññāsikoṇḍañño.
analyzed: etat agga bhikkhave mama sāvakānam bhikkhūnam rattaññūnam yat idam
translated: “Bhikkhus, the most excellent of my disciples who are long-standing elders is Anuruddha.

original: … Mahāpaññānaṁ yadidaṁ sāriputto.🔽… Iddhimantānaṁ yadidaṁ mahāmoggallāno.
analyzed: mahā paññānam yat idam sāriputto  iddhi mantānam yat idam mahā moggallāno
translated: … Of those with great wisdom, Sāriputta.🔽… Of those with psychic powers, Mahāmoggallāna.

original: … Dhutavādānaṁ yadidaṁ mahākassapo.
analyzed: dhuta vādānam yat idam mahākassapo
translated: … Of those who speak about the ascetic practices, Mahākassapa.

original: … Dibbacakkhukānaṁ yadidaṁ anuruddho.🔽… Uccākulikānaṁ yadidaṁ bhaddiyo kāḷigodhāya putto.
analyzed: dibba cakkhukānam yat idam anuruddhaḥ  uccākulikānam yat idam bhaddiyaḥ kāḷigodhāya putto
translated: … Of those with the divine eye, Anuruddha.🔽… Of those from wealthy families, Bhaddiya Kāḷigodhāya’s son.

original: … Mañjussarānaṁ yadidaṁ lakuṇḍaka bhaddiyo.
analyzed: yat idam lakuṇḍaka bhaddiyo
translated: … Of those with a sweet voice, Bhaddiya the dwarf.

original: … Sīhanādikānaṁ yadidaṁ piṇḍolabhāradvājo.
analyzed: yat idam
translated: … Of those with a lion’s roar, Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja.

original: … Dhammakathikānaṁ yadidaṁ puṇṇo mantāṇiputto.
analyzed: dhamma kathikānam yat idam puṇṇaḥ mantāṇi putto
translated: … Of those who give Dhamma talks, Puṇṇa Mantāṇiputta.

original: … saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṁ vibhajantānaṁ yadidaṁ mahākaccāno”ti.
analyzed: saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena attham vibhajantānam yat idam mahākaccāno ti
translated: … Of those who can explain in detail the meaning of what is said in brief, Mahākaccāna.”

original: Vaggo paṭhamo.
analyzed: vaggo paṭhamaḥ
translated: The first sub-chapter is finished.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 1
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Numerical Discourses of the Buddha

original: 15. Dutiyavagga
analyzed: dutiya vagga
translated: . The Second Sub-chapter

original: “Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ manomayaṁ kāyaṁ abhinimminantānaṁ yadidaṁ cūḷapanthako.
analyzed: etat agga bhikkhave mama sāvakānam bhikkhūnam manaḥ mayam kāyam abhinimminantānam yat idam cūḷapanthako
translated: “Amongst my disciples who create a mind-made body, the most outstanding is Cūḷapanthaka.

original: … Cetovivaṭṭakusalānaṁ yadidaṁ cūḷapanthako.
analyzed: yat idam cūḍapanthako
translated: … Of those skilled in the reversal of the mind, Cūḷapanthaka.

original: … Saññāvivaṭṭakusalānaṁ yadidaṁ mahāpanthako.
analyzed: saññā vivaṭṭa kusalānam yat idam mahā panthako
translated: … Of those skilled in the reversal of perception, Mahāpanthaka.

original: … Araṇavihārīnaṁ yadidaṁ subhūti.
analyzed: yat idam subhūti
translated: … Of those who live without conflict, Subhūti.

original: … Dakkhiṇeyyānaṁ yadidaṁ subhūti.🔽… Āraññakānaṁ yadidaṁ revato khadiravaniyo.
analyzed: dakkhiṇeyyānam yat idam subhūti  āraññakānam yat idam
translated: … Most worthy of gifts: Subhūti.🔽… Living in the wilderness: Revata who stays in the acacia forest.

original: … Jhāyīnaṁ yadidaṁ kaṅkhārevato.
analyzed: jhāyīnam yat idam
translated: … Meditators: Revata who has doubts.

original: … Āraddhavīriyānaṁ yadidaṁ soṇo koḷiviso.
analyzed: āraddha vīriyānam yat idam soṇaḥ koḷiviso
translated: … Energetic: Soṇa Koḷivisa.

original: … Kalyāṇavākkaraṇānaṁ yadidaṁ soṇo kuṭikaṇṇo.🔽… Lābhīnaṁ yadidaṁ sīvali.
analyzed: yat idam soṇaḥ kuṭikaṇṇo  lābhīnam yat idam sīvali
translated: … Good speakers: Soṇa Kuṭikaṇṇa.🔽… Receivers of robes, alms-food, dwellings, and medicines: Sīvali.

original: … Saddhādhimuttānaṁ yadidaṁ vakkalī”ti.🔽Vaggo dutiyo.
analyzed: saddhādhim uttānam yat idam vakkalī iti  vaggo dutiyaḥ
translated: … Faithful: Vakkalī.”

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 1
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The second sub-chapter on the best is finished.🔽The Book of the Threes

original: 16. Tatiyavagga
analyzed: tatiya vagga
translated: The third sub-chapter

original: “Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ sikkhākāmānaṁ yadidaṁ rāhulo.
analyzed: etat agga bhikkhave mama sāvakānam bhikkhūnam sikkhā kāmānam yat idam rāhulaḥ
translated: “The best of my monks who want to train are Rāhula.

original: … Saddhāpabbajitānaṁ yadidaṁ raṭṭhapālo.
analyzed: saddhā pabbajitānam yat idam raṭṭhapālaḥ
translated: … Those who have gone forth out of faith: Raṭṭhapāla.

original: … Paṭhamaṁ salākaṁ gaṇhantānaṁ yadidaṁ kuṇḍadhāno.
analyzed: paṭhamam salākam yat idam kuṇḍadhāno
translated: … Those who first take up the voting ticket: Kuṇḍadhāna.

original: … Paṭibhānavantānaṁ yadidaṁ vaṅgīso.
analyzed: yat idam vaṅgīso
translated: … Those who are eloquent: Vaṅgīsa.

original: … Samantapāsādikānaṁ yadidaṁ upaseno vaṅgantaputto.🔽… Senāsanapaññāpakānaṁ yadidaṁ dabbo mallaputto.
analyzed: samantapāsādikānam yat idam upasenaḥ vaṅganta putto  senāsana paññāpakānam yat idam dabbaḥ malla putto
translated: … Those who are inspiring in every way: Upasena Vaṅgantaputta.🔽… Those who assign dwellings: Dabba the Mallian.

original: … devatānaṁ piyamanāpānaṁ yadidaṁ pilindavaccho.
analyzed: devatānam yat idam
translated: … Those who are dear and pleasing to the gods: Pilindavaccha.

original: … Khippābhiññānaṁ yadidaṁ bāhiyo dārucīriyo.
analyzed: khippa abhiññānam yat idam bāhiyaḥ dārucīriyaḥ
translated: … With quick higher knowledge: Bāhiya of the Bark Robe.

original: … Cittakathikānaṁ yadidaṁ kumārakassapo.
analyzed: citta kathikānam yat idam
translated: … With eloquence: Kumāra Kassapa.

original: … Paṭisambhidāpattānaṁ yadidaṁ mahākoṭṭhito”ti.
analyzed: paṭisambhidā pattānam yat idam mahā koṭṭhita uti
translated: … Who have attained the discriminations: Mahā Koṭṭhita.”

original: Vaggo tatiyo.
analyzed: vaggo tatiyaḥ
translated: The third sub-chapter on groups is finished.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 1
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of the Tens

original: 17. Catutthavagga🔽“Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ bahussutānaṁ yadidaṁ ānando.🔽… Satimantānaṁ yadidaṁ ānando.
analyzed: catuttha vagga  etat agga bhikkhave mama sāvakānam bhikkhūnam bahussutānam yat idam ānandaḥ  satimantānam yat idam ānandaḥ
translated: 4. The fourth sub-chapter🔽“The most learned of my learned disciples is Ānanda.🔽… The most mindful of my mindful disciples is Ānanda.

original: … Gatimantānaṁ yadidaṁ ānando.🔽… Dhitimantānaṁ yadidaṁ ānando.
analyzed: ānandaḥ  dhiti mantānam yat idam ānandaḥ
translated: … The most energetic of my energetic disciples is Ānanda.🔽… The most resolute of my resolute disciples is Ānanda.

original: … Upaṭṭhākānaṁ yadidaṁ ānando.
analyzed: upaṭṭhākānam yat idam ānandaḥ
translated: … The most helpful of my helpful disciples is Ānanda.

original: … Mahāparisānaṁ yadidaṁ uruvelakassapo.
analyzed: mahā parisānam yat idam
translated: … The one with the largest following of disciples is Uruvelakassapa.

original: … Kulappasādakānaṁ yadidaṁ kāḷudāyī.
analyzed: kula ppasādakānam yat idam kāḷudāyī
translated: … The most inspiring to lay people is Kāḷudāyī.

original: … Appābādhānaṁ yadidaṁ bākulo.
analyzed: yat idam bākulaḥ
translated: … The healthiest of my disciples is Bākula.

original: … Pubbenivāsaṁ anussarantānaṁ yadidaṁ sobhito.
analyzed: pubbenivāsam anussarantānam yat idam sobhitaḥ
translated: … The most mindful of those recollecting past lives is Sobhita.

original: … Vinayadharānaṁ yadidaṁ upāli.🔽… Bhikkhunovādakānaṁ yadidaṁ nandako.
analyzed: yat idam upāli  bhikkhunovādakānam yat idam nandako
translated: … The most knowledgeable of the Monastic Law is Upāli.🔽… The most inspiring to nuns is Nandaka.

original: … Indriyesu guttadvārānaṁ yadidaṁ nando.
analyzed: yat idam
translated: … The most restrained in the senses is Nanda.

original: … Bhikkhuovādakānaṁ yadidaṁ mahākappino.
analyzed: bhikkhu ovādakānam yat idam mahā kappinaḥ
translated: … The most inspiring to monks is Mahākappina.

original: … Tejodhātukusalānaṁ yadidaṁ sāgato.
analyzed: yat idam sāgataḥ
translated: … with skill in the fire element, it’s Sāgata.

original: … Paṭibhāneyyakānaṁ yadidaṁ rādho.
analyzed: paṭibhāneyyakānam yat idam rādhaḥ
translated: … with eloquence, it’s Rādha.

original: … Lūkhacīvaradharānaṁ yadidaṁ mogharājā”ti.🔽Vaggo catuttho.
analyzed: yat idam mogha rājā ati  vaggo catutthaḥ
translated: … who wear rough robes, it’s Mogharāja.”

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 1
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The fourth sub-chapter on the foremost is finished.🔽The Numerical Discourses of the Buddha

original: 18. Pañcamavagga
analyzed: pañcama vagga
translated: . The Fifth Section

original: “Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, mama sāvikānaṁ bhikkhunīnaṁ rattaññūnaṁ yadidaṁ mahāpajāpatigotamī.
analyzed: etat agga bhikkhave mama sāvikānam bhikkhunīnam rattaññūnam yat idam mahāpajāpatigotamī
translated: “Bhuddharakkhita is the most senior among my nuns disciples.

original: … Mahāpaññānaṁ yadidaṁ khemā.
analyzed: mahā paññānam yat idam khemā
translated: … The most wise is Khemā.

original: … Iddhimantīnaṁ yadidaṁ uppalavaṇṇā.
analyzed: iddhimantīnam yat idam uppala vaṇṇā
translated: … The most powerful in supernormal powers is Uppalavaṇṇā.

original: … Vinayadharānaṁ yadidaṁ paṭācārā.
analyzed: yat idam paṭa ācārā
translated: … The most learned in the Monastic Law is Paṭācārā.

original: … Dhammakathikānaṁ yadidaṁ dhammadinnā.🔽… Jhāyīnaṁ yadidaṁ nandā.
analyzed: dhamma kathikānam yat idam dhamma dinnā  jhāyīnam yat idam nandā
translated: … The best preachers of the Teaching are Dhammadinnā.🔽… The most accomplished in meditation are Nandā.

original: … Āraddhavīriyānaṁ yadidaṁ soṇā.🔽… Dibbacakkhukānaṁ yadidaṁ bakulā.
analyzed: āraddha vīriyānam yat idam soṇā  dibba cakkhukānam yat idam bakulā
translated: … The most energetic are Soṇā.🔽… The most clairvoyant are Bakulā.

original: … Khippābhiññānaṁ yadidaṁ bhaddā kuṇḍalakesā.
analyzed: khippa abhiññānam yat idam bhaddā kuṇḍala kesā
translated: … The most quickly enlightened are Bhaddā Kuṇḍalakesā.

original: … Pubbenivāsaṁ anussarantīnaṁ yadidaṁ bhaddā kāpilānī.
analyzed: pubbenivāsam anussarantīnam yat idam bhaddā kāpilānī
translated: … The most mindful of past lives are Bhaddā Kāpilānī.

original: … Mahābhiññāpattānaṁ yadidaṁ bhaddakaccānā.
analyzed: mahā abhiññā pattānam yat idam bhaddakaccānā
translated: … The most accomplished in the higher wisdoms are Bhaddā Kaccānā.

original: … Lūkhacīvaradharānaṁ yadidaṁ kisāgotamī.
analyzed: yat idam kisāgotamī
translated: … The most austere in robes is Kisāgotamī.”

original: … Saddhādhimuttānaṁ yadidaṁ siṅgālakamātā”ti.🔽Vaggo pañcamo.
analyzed: saddhādhim uttānam yat idam siṅgālaka mātā ati  vaggaḥ pañcamaḥ
translated: … Of those who are resolute in faith, the most outstanding is Siṅgāla’s mother.”

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 1
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The fifth sub-chapter on the most outstanding is finished.

original: 19. Chaṭṭhavagga
analyzed: chaṭṭha vagga
translated: The Book of the Sixes

original: “Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṁ upāsakānaṁ paṭhamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchantānaṁ yadidaṁ tapussabhallikā vāṇijā.
analyzed: etat agga bhikkhave mama sāvakānam upāsakānam paṭhamam saraṇam gacchantānam yat idam tapussabhallikāḥ vāṇijāḥ
translated: “The most outstanding of my lay disciples who first went for refuge are the merchants Tapussa and Bhallika.

original: … Dāyakānaṁ yadidaṁ sudatto gahapati anāthapiṇḍiko.
analyzed: yat idam sudattaḥ gahapati anāthapiṇḍikaḥ
translated: … Of those who give gifts, the most outstanding is the householder Sudatta Anāthapiṇḍika.

original: … Dhammakathikānaṁ yadidaṁ citto gahapati macchikāsaṇḍiko.
analyzed: dhamma kathikānam yat idam cittaḥ gahapati macchikāsaṇḍikaḥ
translated: … Of those who give Dhamma talks, the most outstanding is the householder Citta from Macchikāsaṇḍa.

original: … Catūhi saṅgahavatthūhi parisaṁ saṅgaṇhantānaṁ yadidaṁ hatthako āḷavako.
analyzed: catūhi saṅgaha vatthūhi parisam saṅgaṇhantānam yat idam hatthakaḥ āḷavakaḥ
translated: … Of those who gather a following by means of the four means of gathering disciples, the most outstanding is Hatthaka of Āḷavī.

original: … Paṇītadāyakānaṁ yadidaṁ mahānāmo sakko.
analyzed: paṇīta dāyakānam yat idam mahānāmaḥ sakkaḥ
translated: … Of those who give fine things, the most outstanding is Mahānāma the Sakyan.

original: … Manāpadāyakānaṁ yadidaṁ uggo gahapati vesāliko.
analyzed: manāpa dāyakānam yat idam uggaḥ gahapati vesālikaḥ
translated: … Of those who give pleasing things, the most outstanding is the householder Ugga of Vesālī.

original: … Saṅghupaṭṭhākānaṁ yadidaṁ hatthigāmako uggato gahapati.
analyzed: saṅgha upaṭṭhākānam yat idam hatthi gāmakaḥ uggataḥ gahapati
translated: … Of those who serve the Sangha, the most outstanding is the householder Uggata from Hatthigāma.

original: … Aveccappasannānaṁ yadidaṁ sūrambaṭṭho.
analyzed: avecca ppasannānam yat idam
translated: … Of those who have deep confidence, the most outstanding is Sūra Ambaṭṭha.

original: … Puggalappasannānaṁ yadidaṁ jīvako komārabhacco.
analyzed: puggala ppasannānam yat idam jīvakaḥ komārabhacco
translated: … Of those who have confidence in the person, the most outstanding is Jīvaka Komārabhacca.

original: … Vissāsakānaṁ yadidaṁ nakulapitā gahapatī”ti.
analyzed: vissāsakānam yat idam nakula pitā gahapati iti
translated: … Of those who have confidence in the Saṅgha, the most outstanding is the householder Nakulapitā.”

original: Vaggo chaṭṭho.
analyzed: vaggaḥ chaṭṭhaḥ
translated: The sixth sub-chapter on the most outstanding is finished.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 1
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: Numbered Discourses

original: 20. Sattamavagga
analyzed: sattama vagga
translated: The Seven Factors of Awakening

original: “Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, mama sāvikānaṁ upāsikānaṁ paṭhamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchantīnaṁ yadidaṁ sujātā seniyadhītā.
analyzed: etat agga bhikkhave mama sāvikānam upāsikānam paṭhamam saraṇam gacchantīnam yat idam sujātā seniya dhītā
translated: “The most eminent of my female lay disciples who first went for refuge are Sujātā and Seniyadhītā. …

original: … Dāyikānaṁ yadidaṁ visākhā migāramātā.
analyzed: yat idam visākhā migāra mātā
translated: … who give gifts are Visākhā, Migāra’s mother. …

original: … Bahussutānaṁ yadidaṁ khujjuttarā.
analyzed: yat idam khujjuttarā
translated: … who are learned are Khujjuttarā. …

original: … Mettāvihārīnaṁ yadidaṁ sāmāvatī.
analyzed: yat idam sā amāvatī
translated: … who meditate with loving kindness are Sāmāvatī. …

original: … Jhāyīnaṁ yadidaṁ uttarānandamātā.🔽… Paṇītadāyikānaṁ yadidaṁ suppavāsā koliyadhītā.
analyzed: yat idam uttarānanda mātā  paṇīta dāyikānam yat idam suppavāsā koliya dhītā
translated: … who meditate are Uttarānandamātā. …🔽… who give fine things are Suppavāsā, Koliyans’ daughter. …

original: … Gilānupaṭṭhākīnaṁ yadidaṁ suppiyā upāsikā.
analyzed: gilāna upaṭṭhākīnam yat idam suppiyā upāsikā
translated: … who nurse the sick are the laywoman Suppiyā. …

original: … Aveccappasannānaṁ yadidaṁ kātiyānī.
analyzed: yat idam kātiyānī
translated: … who have deep confidence are Kātiyānī. …

original: … Vissāsikānaṁ yadidaṁ nakulamātā gahapatānī.
analyzed: vissāsikānam yat idam nakula mātā gahapatānī
translated: … who are trustworthy are the laywoman Nakulamātā. …

original: … Anussavappasannānaṁ yadidaṁ kāḷī upāsikā kuraragharikā”ti.
analyzed: anussava ppasannānam yat idam kāḷī upāsikā kuraragharikā ati
translated: … who have confidence based on conviction are the laywoman Kāḷī of Kuraraghara.”

original: vaggo sattamo.
analyzed: vaggaḥ sattamaḥ
translated: The seventh chapter.

original: (Etadaggavaggo niṭṭhito.)🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 1
analyzed: etad agga vaggaḥ niṭṭhitaḥ  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: (The chapter on the most eminent is finished.) 🔽Numbered Discourses

original: 21. Paṭhamavagga
analyzed: paṭhama vagga
translated: The First Chapter

original: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo kañci saṅkhāraṁ niccato upagaccheyya. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam diṭṭhi sampannaḥ puggalo kañci saṅkhāram niccatas upagaccheyya na etam ṭhānam vijjati
translated: “It’s impossible, monks, for a person who has right view to regard any phenomenon as permanent. That possibility does not exist.

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ puthujjano kañci saṅkhāraṁ niccato upagaccheyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yam puthujjanaḥ kañci saṅkhāram niccatas upagaccheyya ṭhānam etam vijjati iti
translated: But it’s possible for an ordinary person to regard any phenomenon as permanent. That possibility does exist.”

original: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo kañci saṅkhāraṁ sukhato upagaccheyya. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam diṭṭhi sampannaḥ puggalo kañci saṅkhāram sukhataḥ upagaccheyya na itam ṭhānam vijjati
translated: “It’s impossible, monks, for a person who has right view to regard any phenomenon as pleasurable. That possibility does not exist.

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ puthujjano kañci saṅkhāraṁ sukhato upagaccheyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yam puthujjanaḥ kañci saṅkhāram sukhataḥ upagaccheyya ṭhānam etam vijjati iti
translated: But it’s possible for an ordinary person to regard any phenomenon as pleasurable. That possibility does exist.”

original: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo kañci dhammaṁ attato upagaccheyya. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam diṭṭhi sampannaḥ puggalo kañci dhammaṃ attataḥ upagaccheyya na etam ṭhānam vijjati
translated: “It’s impossible, monks, for a person who has right view to regard any phenomenon as self. That possibility does not exist.

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ puthujjano kañci dhammaṁ attato upagaccheyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.🔽“Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo mātaraṁ jīvitā voropeyya. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yam puthujjanaḥ kañci dhammaṃ attataḥ upagaccheyya ṭhānam etam vijjati iti  aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam diṭṭhi sampannaḥ puggalaḥ mātaram jīvitā voropeyya na itam ṭhānam vijjati
translated: But it’s possible that an ordinary person might take something to be self.”

original: Ṭhānañca kho, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ puthujjano mātaraṁ jīvitā voropeyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.🔽“Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo pitaraṁ jīvitā voropeyya. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho bhikkhave vijjati yam puthujjanaḥ mātaram jīvitā voropeyya ṭhānam etam vijjati iti  aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam diṭṭhi sampannaḥ puggalaḥ pitaram jīvitā voropeyya na itam ṭhānam vijjati
translated: “It’s impossible, monks, it cannot happen that a person perfected in view might kill their mother. It can happen that an ordinary person might kill their mother.”

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ puthujjano pitaraṁ jīvitā voropeyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yam puthujjanaḥ pitaram jīvitā voropeyya ṭhānam etam vijjati iti
translated: “It’s impossible, monks, it cannot happen that a person perfected in view might kill their father. It can happen that an ordinary person might kill their father.”

original: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo arahantaṁ jīvitā voropeyya. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam diṭṭhi sampannaḥ puggalaḥ arahantam jīvitā voropeyya na itam ṭhānam vijjati
translated: “It’s impossible, monks, it cannot happen that a person perfected in view might kill an perfected one. It can happen that an ordinary person might kill an perfected one.”

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ puthujjano arahantaṁ jīvitā voropeyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yam puthujjanaḥ arahantam jīvitā voropeyya ṭhānam etam vijjati iti
translated: But it’s possible that a regular person might deprive an perfected one of life. And it has happened.”

original: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo tathāgatassa paduṭṭhacitto lohitaṁ uppādeyya. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yat diṭṭhi sampannaḥ puggalaḥ tathāgatassa paduṭṭha cittaḥ lohitam uppādeyya na etam ṭhānam vijjati
translated: “It’s impossible, monks, for a person who has right view to deprive a perfected one of life. It can’t happen.

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ puthujjano tathāgatassa paduṭṭhacitto lohitaṁ uppādeyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yat puthujjanaḥ tathāgatassa paduṭṭha cittaḥ lohitam uppādeyya ṭhānam etam vijjati iti
translated: But it’s possible that a regular person might deprive a perfected one of life. And it has happened.”

original: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo saṅghaṁ bhindeyya. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam diṭṭhi sampannaḥ puggalaḥ saṅgham bhindeyya na itam ṭhānam vijjati
translated: “It’s impossible, monks, for a person who has right view to cause a schism in the Sangha. It can’t happen.

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ puthujjano saṅghaṁ bhindeyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yam puthujjanaḥ saṅgham bhindeyya ṭhānam etam vijjati iti
translated: But it’s possible that a regular person might cause a schism in the Sangha. And it has happened.”

original: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo aññaṁ satthāraṁ uddiseyya. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam diṭṭhi sampannaḥ puggalaḥ aññam satthāram uddiseyya na itam ṭhānam vijjati
translated: “It’s impossible, monks, for a person who has right view to acknowledge another teacher. It can’t happen.

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ puthujjano aññaṁ satthāraṁ uddiseyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yam puthujjanaḥ aññam satthāram uddiseyya ṭhānam etam vijjati iti
translated: But it’s possible that a person of no integrity would choose another teacher. That’s possible.”

original: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ ekissā lokadhātuyā dve arahanto sammāsambuddhā apubbaṁ acarimaṁ uppajjeyyuṁ. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yat ekissā lokadhātuyā dve arahantaḥ sammāsambuddhāḥ apubbam acarimam uppajjeyyu na etam ṭhānam vijjati
translated: “It’s impossible, monks, it cannot happen that two perfected ones, fully awakened Buddhas could arise simultaneously in one world-system. That possibility doesn’t exist.

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ ekissā lokadhātuyā ekova arahaṁ sammāsambuddho uppajjeyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.🔽Vaggo paṭhamo.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yat ekissā lokadhātuyā ekaḥ iva araham sammāsambuddhaḥ uppajjeyya ṭhānam etam vijjati iti  vaggo paṭhamaḥ
translated: But it’s possible that one perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha, could arise in one world-system. That’s possible.”

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 1
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The first sub-chapter is finished.🔽The Numerical Discourses With Verses

original: 22. Dutiyavagga🔽“Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ ekissā lokadhātuyā dve rājāno cakkavattī apubbaṁ acarimaṁ uppajjeyyuṁ. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: dutiya vagga  aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yat ekissā lokadhātuyā dve rājāno cakkavattī apubbam acarimam uppajjeyyu na etam ṭhānam vijjati
translated: . The Second Sub-chapter🔽“It’s impossible, monks, it cannot happen that two Wheel-turning Monarchs could arise simultaneously in one world-system. That possibility doesn’t exist.

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ ekissā lokadhātuyā eko rājā cakkavattī uppajjeyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yat ekissā lokadhātuyā ekaḥ rājā cakkavattī uppajjeyya ṭhānam etam vijjati iti
translated: But it’s possible that one Wheel-turning Monarch could arise in one world-system. That’s possible.”

original: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ itthī arahaṁ assa sammāsambuddho. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam itthī arahan assa sammāsambuddhaḥ na itam ṭhānam vijjati
translated: “It’s impossible for a woman to be a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha. That possibility doesn’t exist.

original: Ṭhānañca kho, etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ puriso arahaṁ assa sammāsambuddho. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yam purisaḥ arahan assa sammāsambuddhaḥ ṭhānam etam vijjati iti
translated: But it’s possible for a man to be a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha. That possibility does exist.”

original: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ itthī rājā assa cakkavattī. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam itthī rājā assa cakkavattī na etat ṭhānam vijjati
translated: “It’s impossible for a woman to be a monarch who’d rules the continent. That possibility doesn’t exist.

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ puriso rājā assa cakkavattī. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yam purisaḥ rājā assa cakkavattī ṭhānam etam vijjati iti
translated: But it’s possible for a man to be a monarch who’d rules the continent. That possibility does exist.”

original: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ itthī sakkattaṁ kāreyya …pe… mārattaṁ kāreyya …pe… brahmattaṁ kāreyya. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam itthī sakkattam kāreyya pe mārattam kāreyya pe brahmattam kāreyya na itam ṭhānam vijjati
translated: “It’s impossible for a woman to exercise the rulership of Sakka … the rulership of Māra … the rulership of Brahmā. That possibility doesn’t exist.

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ puriso sakkattaṁ kāreyya …pe… mārattaṁ kāreyya …pe… brahmattaṁ kāreyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yam puriso sakkattam kāreyya pe mārattam kāreyya pe brahmattam kāreyya ṭhānam etam vijjati iti
translated: But it’s possible for a man to exercise the rulership of Sakka … the rulership of Māra … the rulership of Brahmā. That possibility does exist.”

original: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ kāyaduccaritassa iṭṭho kanto manāpo vipāko nibbatteyya. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yat kāya duccaritassa iṭṭhaḥ kantaḥ manāpaḥ vipākaḥ nibbatteyya na etat ṭhānam vijjati
translated: “It’s impossible, monks, for the result of misconduct by body to be pleasant, agreeable, and pleasurable. That possibility doesn’t exist.

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ kāyaduccaritassa aniṭṭho akanto amanāpo vipāko nibbatteyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yat kāya duccaritassa aniṭṭhaḥ a kantaḥ a manāpaḥ vipākaḥ nibbatteyya ṭhānam etam vijjati iti
translated: But it’s possible for the result of misconduct by body to be painful, disagreeable, and unpleasurable. That possibility does exist.”

original: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ vacīduccaritassa …pe… yaṁ manoduccaritassa iṭṭho kanto manāpo vipāko nibbatteyya. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam vacī duccaritassa pe yam manaḥ duccaritassa iṭṭhaḥ kantaḥ manāpaḥ vipākaḥ nibbatteyya na etam ṭhānam vijjati
translated: “It’s impossible, monks, for the result of misconduct by speech … for the result of misconduct by mind to be pleasant, agreeable, and pleasurable. That possibility doesn’t exist.

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ manoduccaritassa aniṭṭho akanto amanāpo vipāko nibbatteyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.🔽Vaggo dutiyo.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yat manaḥ duccaritassa aniṭṭhaḥ a kantaḥ a manāpaḥ vipākaḥ nibbatteyya ṭhānam etam vijjati iti  vaggo dutiyaḥ
translated: But it’s possible for the result of misconduct by mind to be painful, disagreeable, and unpleasurable. That possibility does exist.”

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 1
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The second sub-chapter on the aggregates is finished.🔽The Numerical Discourses with Threes

original: 23. Tatiyavagga
analyzed: tatiya vagga
translated: The Third Chapter

original: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ kāyasucaritassa aniṭṭho akanto amanāpo vipāko nibbatteyya. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam kāya su caritassa aniṭṭhaḥ a kantaḥ a manāpaḥ vipākaḥ nibbatteyya na etat ṭhānam vijjati
translated: “It’s impossible, monks, for the result of good conduct by body to be painful, disagreeable, and unpleasurable. That possibility doesn’t exist.

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ kāyasucaritassa iṭṭho kanto manāpo vipāko nibbatteyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yat kāya su caritassa iṭṭhaḥ kantaḥ manāpaḥ vipākaḥ nibbatteyya ṭhānam etam vijjati iti
translated: But it’s possible that the result of good bodily action may be pleasant.

original: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ vacīsucaritassa …pe… manosucaritassa aniṭṭho akanto amanāpo vipāko nibbatteyya. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam vacī su caritassa pe manaḥ su caritassa aniṭṭhaḥ a kantaḥ a manāpaḥ vipākaḥ nibbatteyya na etat ṭhānam vijjati
translated: “It’s impossible, monks, it cannot happen that the result of good verbal action … good mental action may be unpleasant. That possibility doesn’t exist.

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ manosucaritassa iṭṭho kanto manāpo vipāko nibbatteyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yat manaḥ su caritassa iṭṭhaḥ kantaḥ manāpaḥ vipākaḥ nibbatteyya ṭhānam etam vijjati iti
translated: But it’s possible that the result of good mental action may be pleasant.

original: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ kāyaduccaritasamaṅgī tannidānā tappaccayā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjeyya. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam kāya duccarita samaṅgī tad nidānā tad paccayā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjeyya na itam ṭhānam vijjati
translated: “It’s impossible, monks, it cannot happen that one who is deficient in bodily good conduct, after the break-up of the body, after death, may be reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world. That possibility doesn’t exist.

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ kāyaduccaritasamaṅgī tannidānā tappaccayā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjeyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.🔽“Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ vacīduccaritasamaṅgī …pe… yaṁ manoduccaritasamaṅgī
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yam kāya duccarita samaṅgī tad nidānā tad paccayā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjeyya ṭhānam etam vijjati iti  aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam vacī duccarita samaṅgī pe yam manaḥ duccarita samaṅgī
translated: It’s impossible, monks, that one who’s committed an offense by way of body, when their body breaks up, after death, might be reborn in a good destination, a heavenly world.🔽That possibility does not exist.

original: tannidānā tappaccayā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjeyya.
analyzed: tad nidānā tad paccayā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjeyya
translated: But it’s possible that one who’s committed an offense by way of body, when their body breaks up, after death, might be reborn in a lower realm, a bad destination, a fallen state, hell. That possibility does exist.”🔽It’s impossible, monks, that one who’s committed an offense by way of body, when their body breaks up, after death, might be reborn in a good destination, a heavenly world.

original: Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: na itam ṭhānam vijjati
translated: That possibility does not exist.

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ manoduccaritasamaṅgī tannidānā tappaccayā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjeyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yat manaḥ duccarita samaṅgī tad nidānā tad paccayā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjeyya ṭhānam etam vijjati iti
translated: But it’s possible that one who’s committed an offense by way of body, when their body breaks up, after death, might be reborn in a lower realm, a bad destination, a fallen state, hell. That possibility does exist.”

original: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ kāyasucaritasamaṅgī tannidānā tappaccayā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjeyya. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam kāya su carita samaṅgī tad nidānā tad paccayā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjeyya na itam ṭhānam vijjati
translated: “It’s impossible for one who’s practiced well in body, speech, and mind, who’s not deficient in virtuous behavior, and who’s accomplished in wisdom to be reborn in hell, the animal realm, or the ghost realm. It’s impossible for them to go to the nether world.

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ kāyasucaritasamaṅgī tannidānā tappaccayā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjeyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yam kāya su carita samaṅgī tad nidānā tad paccayā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjeyya ṭhānam etam vijjati iti
translated: But it’s possible for one who’s practiced well in body, speech, and mind, who’s not deficient in virtuous behavior, and who’s accomplished in wisdom to be reborn in a good place, a heavenly world.”

original: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ vacīsucaritasamaṅgī …pe… yaṁ manosucaritasamaṅgī
analyzed: aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam vacī su carita samaṅgī pe yam manaḥ su carita samaṅgī
translated: “It’s impossible for one who’s practiced well in body, speech, and mind, who’s not deficient in virtuous behavior, and who’s accomplished in wisdom

original: tannidānā tappaccayā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ🔽upapajjeyya. Netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: tad nidānā tad paccayā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam niraya 🔽upapajjeyya na itam ṭhānam vijjati
translated: to be reborn in hell, the animal realm, or the ghost realm. It’s impossible for them to go to the nether world.

original: Ṭhānañca kho etaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati yaṁ manosucaritasamaṅgī tannidānā tappaccayā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjeyya. Ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.🔽vaggo tatiyo.
analyzed: ṭhānam ca kho eta bhikkhave vijjati yat manaḥ su carita samaṅgī tad nidānā tad paccayā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjeyya ṭhānam etam vijjati iti  vaggo tatiyaḥ
translated: But it is possible that one who has good mental conduct… will, because of that cause and condition, be reborn in a good place, a heavenly world. That is possible.”🔽The third sub-chapter on grounds is finished.

original: Aṭṭhānapāḷi niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: aṭṭhānapāḷi niṭṭhitā
translated: The section on grounds is finished.🔽The Book of the Ones

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 1🔽24. Paṭhamavagga
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya  paṭhama vagga
translated: First Section

original: “Ekadhammo, bhikkhave, bhāvito bahulīkato ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: eka dhammaḥ bhikkhave bhāvitaḥ bahulīkataḥ ekanta nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati
translated: “One thing, monastics, when developed and cultivated, leads to a single effect, a single outcome: complete disenchantment, dispassion, cessation, peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.

original: Katamo ekadhammo?
analyzed: katamaḥ eka dhammaḥ
translated: What is that one thing?

original: Buddhānussati.
analyzed: buddha anussati
translated: Recollection of the Buddha.

original: Ayaṁ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattatī”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho bhikkhave eka dhammaḥ bhāvitaḥ bahulīkataḥ ekanta nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati iti
translated: This one thing, when developed and cultivated, leads to a single effect, a single outcome: complete disenchantment, dispassion, cessation, peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.”

original: “Ekadhammo, bhikkhave, bhāvito bahulīkato ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: eka dhammaḥ bhikkhave bhāvitaḥ bahulīkataḥ ekanta nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati
translated: “One thing, monastics, when developed and cultivated, leads to a single effect, a single outcome: complete disenchantment, dispassion, cessation, peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.

original: Katamo ekadhammo?
analyzed: katamaḥ eka dhammaḥ
translated: What is that one thing?

original: Dhammānussati …pe… saṅghānussati … sīlānussati … cāgānussati … devatānussati … ānāpānassati … maraṇassati … kāyagatāsati … upasamānussati.
analyzed: dhamma anussati pe saṅgha anussati sīla anussati cāga anussati devatā anussati āna apāna ssati maraṇa ssati kāyagata asati upasama anussati
translated: Recollection of the devas …🔽Mindfulness of in-and-out breathing …🔽Recollection of death …🔽Mindfulness directed to the body …🔽Recollection of peace.

original: Ayaṁ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattatī”ti.🔽Vaggo paṭhamo.
analyzed: ayam kho bhikkhave eka dhammaḥ bhāvitaḥ bahulīkataḥ ekanta nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati iti  vaggo paṭhamaḥ
translated: “This one dhamma, when developed and cultivated, leads to … the unbinding of mind.”🔽The first sub-chapter on one is finished.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 1
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Numerical Discourses on One

original: 25. Dutiyavagga
analyzed: dutiya vagga
translated: The Second Sub-chapter on One

original: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā akusalā dhammā
analyzed: na aha bhikkhave aññam eka dhammam pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannāḥ vā akusalāḥ dhammāḥ
translated: “Monks, I don’t see even one other thing that leads to the arising of unarisen unskillful qualities and to the growth and increase of arisen unskillful qualities like wrong view.

original: uppajjanti uppannā vā akusalā dhammā bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṁvattanti yathayidaṁ,🔽bhikkhave, micchādiṭṭhi.
analyzed: uppajjanti uppannāḥ vā akusalāḥ dhammāḥ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya savattanti  bhikkhave micchādiṭṭhi
translated: Wrong view, when developed and pursued, leads to the arising of unarisen unskillful qualities and to the growth and increase of arisen unskillful qualities.”🔽“Monks, I don’t see even one other thing that leads to the arising of unarisen skillful qualities and to the growth and increase of arisen skillful qualities like right view.

original: Micchādiṭṭhikassa, bhikkhave, anuppannā ceva akusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca akusalā dhammā bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṁvattantī”ti.
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhikassa bhikkhave anuppannā ca iva akusalāḥ dhammāḥ uppajjanti uppannāḥ ca akusalāḥ dhammāḥ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya savattanti iti
translated: Right view, when developed and pursued, leads to the arising of unarisen skillful qualities and to the growth and increase of arisen skillful qualities.”

original: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā kusalā dhammā
analyzed: na aha bhikkhave aññam eka dhammam pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannāḥ vā kusalāḥ dhammāḥ
translated: “Bhikkhus, I do not see even one other thing on account of which unarisen wholesome qualities do not arise …

original: uppajjanti uppannā vā kusalā dhammā bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṁvattanti yathayidaṁ,🔽bhikkhave, sammādiṭṭhi.
analyzed: uppajjanti uppannāḥ vā kusalāḥ dhammāḥ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya savattanti  bhikkhave sammādiṭṭhi
translated: “Bhikkhus, I do not see even one other thing on account of which unarisen wholesome qualities arise and arisen wholesome qualities increase and expand so much as right view.

original: Sammādiṭṭhikassa, bhikkhave, anuppannā ceva kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca kusalā dhammā bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṁvattantī”ti.
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhikassa bhikkhave anuppannā ca iva kusalāḥ dhammāḥ uppajjanti uppannāḥ ca kusalāḥ dhammāḥ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya savattanti iti
translated: For one of right view, unarisen wholesome qualities arise and arisen wholesome qualities increase and expand.”

original: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā kusalā dhammā nuppajjanti uppannā vā kusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, micchādiṭṭhi.
analyzed: na aha bhikkhave aññam eka dhammam pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannāḥ vā kusalāḥ dhammāḥ na uppajjanti uppannāḥ vā kusalāḥ dhammāḥ parihāyanti bhikkhave micchādiṭṭhi
translated: “Bhikkhus, I do not see even one other thing on account of which unarisen unwholesome qualities arise and arisen unwholesome qualities increase and expand so much as wrong view.

original: Micchādiṭṭhikassa, bhikkhave, anuppannā ceva kusalā dhammā nuppajjanti uppannā ca kusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhikassa bhikkhave anuppannā ca iva kusalāḥ dhammāḥ na uppajjanti uppannā ca kusalāḥ dhammāḥ parihāyanti iti
translated: For one of wrong view, unarisen unwholesome qualities arise and arisen unwholesome qualities increase and expand.”

original: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā akusalā dhammā nuppajjanti uppannā vā akusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, sammādiṭṭhi.
analyzed: na aha bhikkhave aññam eka dhammam pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannāḥ vā akusalāḥ dhammāḥ na uppajjanti uppannāḥ vā akusalāḥ dhammāḥ parihāyanti bhikkhave sammādiṭṭhi
translated: “Bhikkhus, I do not see even one other thing on account of which unarisen unwholesome qualities arise and arisen unwholesome qualities increase and expand so much as wrong view.

original: Sammādiṭṭhikassa, bhikkhave, anuppannā ceva akusalā dhammā nuppajjanti uppannā ca akusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhikassa bhikkhave anuppannā ca iva akusalāḥ dhammāḥ nuppajjanti uppannā ca akusalāḥ dhammā parihāyanti iti
translated: Unwholesome qualities arise in one who has wrong view and, having arisen, they increase and expand.”

original: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā micchādiṭṭhi uppajjati uppannā vā micchādiṭṭhi pavaḍḍhati yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, ayonisomanasikāro.
analyzed: na aha bhikkhave aññam eka dhammam pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā micchādiṭṭhi uppajjati uppannā vā micchādiṭṭhi pavaḍḍhati bhikkhave a yoniso manasikāro
translated: “Bhikkhus, I do not see even one other thing on account of which unarisen wrong view arises and arisen wrong view increases so much as unwise attention.

original: Ayoniso, bhikkhave, manasi karoto anuppannā ceva micchādiṭṭhi uppajjati uppannā ca micchādiṭṭhi pavaḍḍhatī”ti.
analyzed: ayonisaḥ bhikkhave manasi karotaḥ anuppannā ca iva micchādiṭṭhi uppajjati uppannā ca micchādiṭṭhi pavaḍḍhati iti
translated: Wrong view arises in one who attends unwisely and, having arisen, it increases and expands.”

original: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā sammādiṭṭhi uppajjati uppannā vā sammādiṭṭhi pavaḍḍhati yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, yonisomanasikāro.
analyzed: na aha bhikkhave aññam eka dhammam pi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā sammādiṭṭhi uppajjati uppannā vā sammādiṭṭhi pavaḍḍhati bhikkhave yoniso manasikāro
translated: “Bhikkhus, I do not see even one other thing on account of which unarisen right view arises and arisen right view comes to fulfilment by development so much as this: proper attention.

original: Yoniso, bhikkhave, manasi karoto anuppannā ceva sammādiṭṭhi uppajjati uppannā ca sammādiṭṭhi pavaḍḍhatī”ti.
analyzed: yonisaḥ bhikkhave manasi karotaḥ anuppannā ca iva sammādiṭṭhi uppajjati uppannā ca sammādiṭṭhi pavaḍḍhati iti
translated: For one who attends properly, bhikkhus, unarisen right view arises and arisen right view comes to fulfilment by development.”

original: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ uppajjanti yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, micchādiṭṭhi.
analyzed: na aha bhikkhave aññam eka dhammam pi samanupassāmi yena sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam uppajjanti bhikkhave micchādiṭṭhi
translated: “Bhikkhus, I do not see even one other thing on account of which beings pass away from here and reappear in a state of deprivation, in an unhappy destination, in perdition, even in hell, so much as wrong view.

original: Micchādiṭṭhiyā, bhikkhave, samannāgatā sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ uppajjantī”ti.
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhiyā bhikkhave samannāgatā sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam uppajjanti iti
translated: Beings with wrong view, bhikkhus, pass away from here and reappear in a state of deprivation, in an unhappy destination, in perdition, even in hell.”

original: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ uppajjanti yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, sammādiṭṭhi.
analyzed: na aha bhikkhave aññam eka dhammam pi samanupassāmi yena sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam uppajjanti bhikkhave sammādiṭṭhi
translated: “Bhikkhus, I do not see even one other thing on account of which, with the breakup of the body, after death, beings are reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world, as on account of right view.

original: Sammādiṭṭhiyā, bhikkhave, samannāgatā sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ uppajjantī”ti.
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhiyā bhikkhave samannāgatā sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam uppajjanti iti
translated: Those beings who possess right view are reborn, with the breakup of the body, after death, in a good destination, in a heavenly world.”

original: “Micchādiṭṭhikassa, bhikkhave, purisapuggalassa yañceva kāyakammaṁ yathādiṭṭhi samattaṁ🔽samādinnaṁ yañca vacīkammaṁ …pe… yañca manokammaṁ yathādiṭṭhi samattaṁ samādinnaṁ🔽yā ca cetanā yā ca patthanā yo ca paṇidhi ye ca saṅkhārā sabbe te dhammā aniṭṭhāya
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhikassa bhikkhave purisa puggalassa yat ca iva kāya kammam yathādiṭṭhi  samādinnam yat ca vacī kammam pe yat ca manaḥ kammam yathādiṭṭhi samattam samādinna  yā ca cetanā yā ca patthanā yo ca paṇidhi ye ca saṅkhārā sabbe te dhammā a niṭṭhāya
translated: “Bhikkhus, in a person of wrong view whatever bodily kamma,🔽verbal kamma, and mental kamma he instigates and undertakes in accordance with that view,

original: akantāya amanāpāya ahitāya dukkhāya saṁvattanti.
analyzed: a kantāya a manāpāya ahitāya dukkhāya savattanti
translated: whatever his volition, yearning, inclination, and volitional activities, all lead to what is unwished for, undesired, and disagreeable, to harm and suffering.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Diṭṭhi hissa, bhikkhave, pāpikā.
analyzed: diṭṭhi hissa bhikkhave pāpikā
translated: Because the view is bad.

original: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, nimbabījaṁ vā kosātakibījaṁ vā tittakālābubījaṁ vā allāya
analyzed: seyyathā api bhikkhave nimba bījam vā kosātaki bījam vā tittaka alābu bījam vā allāya
translated: Suppose, bhikkhus, a seed of neem would be planted in moist soil.

original: pathaviyā nikkhittaṁ yañceva pathavirasaṁ upādiyati yañca āporasaṁ upādiyati sabbaṁ
analyzed: pathaviyā nikkhittam yat ca iva pathavi rasam upādiyati yat ca āpo rasam upādiyati sabba
translated: whatever is put on the earth, and whatever takes the taste of the earth and the taste of water,

original: taṁ tittakattāya kaṭukattāya asātattāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: tam tittaka ttāya kaṭuka ttāya asāta ttāya savattati
translated: Whatever tastes it takes up from the earth, or from water, all that leads to a bitter, burning, and unpleasant result.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Bījañhissa, bhikkhave, pāpakaṁ.
analyzed: bījam hissa bhikkhave pāpaka
translated: Because the seed is bad.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, micchādiṭṭhikassa purisapuggalassa yañceva kāyakammaṁ yathādiṭṭhi🔽samattaṁ samādinnaṁ yañca vacīkammaṁ …pe… yañca manokammaṁ yathādiṭṭhi samattaṁ samādinnaṁ🔽yā ca cetanā yā ca patthanā yo ca paṇidhi ye ca saṅkhārā sabbe te dhammā aniṭṭhāya
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave micchādiṭṭhikassa purisa puggalassa yat ca iva kāya kammam yathādiṭṭhi  samattam samādinnam yat ca vacī kammam pe yat ca manaḥ kammam yathādiṭṭhi samattam samādinna  yā ca cetanā yā ca patthanā yo ca paṇidhi ye ca saṅkhārā sabbe te dhammā a niṭṭhāya
translated: In the same way, for a person with wrong view, whatever bodily,🔽verbal, or mental action he undertakes in accordance with that view,

original: akantāya amanāpāya ahitāya dukkhāya saṁvattanti.
analyzed: a kantāya a manāpāya ahitāya dukkhāya savattanti
translated: whatever his intentions, aims, and wishes, and whatever his volitions, all lead to what is undesirable, unwanted, and unpleasant, to harm and suffering.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Diṭṭhi hissa, bhikkhave, pāpikā”ti.
analyzed: diṭṭhi hi ssa bhikkhave pāpikā ati
translated: Because his view is bad.”

original: “Sammādiṭṭhikassa, bhikkhave, purisapuggalassa yañceva kāyakammaṁ yathādiṭṭhi samattaṁ
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhikassa bhikkhave purisa puggalassa yat ca iva kāya kammam yathādiṭṭhi
translated: “For a person with right view, bhikkhus, whatever bodily,🔽verbal, or mental action he undertakes in accordance with that view,

original: samādinnaṁ yañca vacīkammaṁ …pe… yañca manokammaṁ yathādiṭṭhi samattaṁ samādinnaṁ
analyzed: samādinnam yat ca vacī kammam pe yat ca manaḥ kammam yathādiṭṭhi samattam samādinna
translated: any verbal or mental action that he has undertaken in accordance with that view,

original: yā ca cetanā yā ca patthanā yo ca paṇidhi ye ca saṅkhārā sabbe te dhammā iṭṭhāya
analyzed: yā ca cetanā yā ca patthanā yo ca paṇidhi ye ca saṅkhārā sabbe te dhammā iṭṭhāya
translated: whatever intention, whatever desire, whatever wish, whatever action he has undertaken in accordance with that view,

original: kantāya manāpāya hitāya sukhāya saṁvattanti.
analyzed: kantāya manāpāya hitāya sukhāya savattanti
translated: all lead to what is likeable, desirable, agreeable, to happiness.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Diṭṭhi hissa, bhikkhave, bhaddikā.
analyzed: diṭṭhi hissa bhikkhave bhaddikā
translated: Because his view is good.🔽Suppose there were a seed of sugar cane, hill rice, or grape,

original: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, ucchubījaṁ vā sālibījaṁ vā muddikābījaṁ vā allāya pathaviyā
analyzed: seyyathā api bhikkhave ucchu bījam vā sāli bījam vā muddikā bījam vā allāya pathaviyā
translated: and it was planted in moist soil🔽and it took up water and nutrients from the soil and drew up moisture from below and spread out shade above,

original: nikkhittaṁ yañceva pathavirasaṁ upādiyati yañca āporasaṁ upādiyati sabbaṁ taṁ madhurattāya
analyzed: nikkhittam yat ca iva pathavi rasam upādiyati yat ca āpo rasam upādiyati sabbam tam madhura ttāya
translated: all would tend to sweetness,

original: sātattāya asecanakattāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: sātattāya asecanakattāya savattati
translated: to juiciness, to flavour.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Bījaṁ hissa, bhikkhave, bhaddakaṁ.
analyzed: bījam hissa bhikkhave bhaddaka
translated: Because the seed is good.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, sammādiṭṭhikassa purisapuggalassa yañceva kāyakammaṁ yathādiṭṭhi
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave sammādiṭṭhikassa purisa puggalassa yat ca iva kāya kammam yathādiṭṭhi
translated: In the same way, for a person with right view, whatever bodily,

original: samattaṁ samādinnaṁ yañca vacīkammaṁ …pe… yañca manokammaṁ yathādiṭṭhi samattaṁ samādinnaṁ
analyzed: samattam samādinnam yat ca vacī kammam pe yat ca manaḥ kammam yathādiṭṭhi samattam samādinna
translated: Whatever verbal deeds …🔽Whatever mental deeds …

original: yā ca cetanā yā ca patthanā yo ca paṇidhi ye ca saṅkhārā sabbe te dhammā iṭṭhāya
analyzed: yā ca cetanā yā ca patthanā yo ca paṇidhi ye ca saṅkhārā sabbe te dhammā iṭṭhāya
translated: Whatever intentions, plans, wishes, and volitions there are that are in accordance with that view,

original: kantāya manāpāya hitāya sukhāya saṁvattanti.
analyzed: kantāya manāpāya hitāya sukhāya savattanti
translated: all lead to what is wished for, desired, agreeable, and likeable, to well-being and happiness.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Diṭṭhi hissa, bhikkhave, bhaddikā”ti.
analyzed: diṭṭhi hissa bhikkhave bhaddikā ati
translated: Because the view is good.”

original: Vaggo dutiyo.
analyzed: vaggo dutiyaḥ
translated: The second sub-chapter on views is finished.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 1
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of the Threes

original: 26. Tatiyavagga
analyzed: tatiya vagga
translated: . The third sub-chapter

original: “Ekapuggalo, bhikkhave, loke uppajjamāno uppajjati bahujanaahitāya bahujanaasukhāya, bahuno janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: eka puggalaḥ bhikkhave loke uppajjamānaḥ uppajjati bahu jana ahitāya bahu jana asukhāya bahunaḥ janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya deva manussānaṃ
translated: “One person appears in the world for the harm of many people, for the unhappiness of many people, for the ruin, harm, and suffering of many people, including gods and humans.

original: Katamo ekapuggalo?
analyzed: katamaḥ eka puggalaḥ
translated: Who is that one person?

original: Micchādiṭṭhiko hoti viparītadassano.
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhikaḥ hoti viparīta dassano
translated: One with wrong view, who has a distorted perspective.

original: So bahujanaṁ saddhammā vuṭṭhāpetvā asaddhamme patiṭṭhāpeti.
analyzed: saḥ bahu janam saddhammā vuṭṭhāpetvā asaddhamme patiṭṭhāpeti
translated: They lead many people away from the true Teaching and establish them in a false one.

original: Ayaṁ kho, bhikkhave, ekapuggalo loke uppajjamāno uppajjati bahujanaahitāya bahujanaasukhāya, bahuno janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya devamanussānan”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho bhikkhave eka puggalaḥ loke uppajjamānaḥ uppajjati bahu jana ahitāya bahu jana asukhāya bahunaḥ janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya deva manussānaṃ ti
translated: This is the one person who arises in the world for the harm, unhappiness, and misery of the people, for the loss, harm, and misery of gods and humans.”

original: “Ekapuggalo, bhikkhave, loke uppajjamāno uppajjati bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: eka puggalaḥ bhikkhave loke uppajjamānaḥ uppajjati bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya bahunaḥ janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussāna
translated: “Bhikkhus, one person arises in the world for the welfare, happiness, and benefit of the people, for the sake of the world’s benefit, welfare, and happiness, of gods and humans.

original: Katamo ekapuggalo?
analyzed: katamaḥ eka puggalaḥ
translated: What is that one person?

original: Sammādiṭṭhiko hoti aviparītadassano.
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhikaḥ hoti a viparīta dassano
translated: One who has right view, whose view is straight.

original: So bahujanaṁ asaddhammā vuṭṭhāpetvā saddhamme patiṭṭhāpeti.
analyzed: saḥ bahu janam asat dhammā vuṭṭhāpetvā saddhamme patiṭṭhāpeti
translated: Having drawn many people away from the wrong path, he establishes them in the right path.

original: Ayaṁ kho, bhikkhave, ekapuggalo loke uppajjamāno uppajjati bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho bhikkhave eka puggalaḥ loke uppajjamānaḥ uppajjati bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussānam ti
translated: This is the one person who arises in the world for the welfare, happiness, and benefit of the people, for the sake of the world’s benefit, welfare, and happiness, of gods and humans.”

original: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yaṁ evaṁ mahāsāvajjaṁ yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, micchādiṭṭhi.
analyzed: na aha bhikkhave aññam eka dhammam pi samanupassāmi yam evam mahā sāvajjam bhikkhave micchādiṭṭhi
translated: “Bhikkhus, I do not see even one other thing on account of which unarisen wrong view arises and arisen wrong view increases and expands so much as lack of clear comprehension.

original: Micchādiṭṭhiparamāni, bhikkhave, mahāsāvajjānī”ti.
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhi paramāni bhikkhave mahā sāvajjāni iti
translated: Wrong view is the most reprehensible of the reprehensible things.”

original: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekapuggalampi samanupassāmi yo evaṁ bahujanaahitāya paṭipanno
analyzed: na aha bhikkhave aññam eka puggalam pi samanupassāmi yaḥ evam bahu jana ahitāya paṭipanno
translated: “Monks, I do not see even one other thing that, when undertaken and practiced, leads to such harm and suffering for the world as wrong view.

original: bahujanaasukhāya, bahuno janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya devamanussānaṁ yathayidaṁ,🔽bhikkhave, makkhali moghapuriso.
analyzed: bahu jana asukhāya bahunaḥ janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya deva manussānam  bhikkhave makkhali moghapuriso
translated: Wrong view, when undertaken and practiced, leads to the harm and suffering of many people, to the detriment, harm, and suffering of gods and humans.🔽There is the case where the worthless man Moggallāna has appeared in the world, a danger to the devas, a danger to the world.

original: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, nadīmukhe khippaṁ uḍḍeyya bahūnaṁ macchānaṁ ahitāya dukkhāya anayāya byasanāya;
analyzed: seyyathā api bhikkhave nadī mukhe khippam uḍḍeyya bahūnam macchānam ahitāya dukkhāya anayāya byasanāya
translated: Just as at the mouth of a river the water rushes out and flows far, leading to the harm, suffering, and death of many sea-monsters, fishes, and turtles,

original: evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, makkhali moghapuriso manussakhippaṁ maññe loke uppanno bahūnaṁ sattānaṁ ahitāya dukkhāya anayāya byasanāyā”ti.
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave makkhali mogha purisaḥ manussa khippam maññe loke uppannaḥ bahūnam sattānam ahitāya dukkhāya anayāya byasanāya ati
translated: in the same way, the worthless man Moggallāna has appeared in the world, a danger to the devas, a danger to the world, leading to the harm, suffering, and death of many people.”

original: “Durakkhāte, bhikkhave, dhammavinaye yo ca samādapeti yañca samādapeti yo ca samādapito tathattāya paṭipajjati sabbe te bahuṁ apuññaṁ pasavanti.
analyzed: durakkhāte bhikkhave dhamma vinaye yaḥ ca samādapeti yat ca samādapeti yaḥ ca samādapito tathattāya paṭipajjati sabbe te bahum apuññam pasavanti
translated: “Monks, there are four things that, when undertaken & practiced, lead to the harm & suffering of many people, to the detriment, harm, & suffering of gods & humans.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Which four?🔽There is the case where a teacher has not penetrated or fully understood things as they actually are. He teaches a doctrine of kamma, a doctrine of deeds, a doctrine of energy.

original: Durakkhātattā, bhikkhave, dhammassā”ti.
analyzed: durakkhāta ttā bhikkhave dhammassa ati
translated: He has disciples who are not penetrating or fully understanding things as they actually are. They do not teach a doctrine of kamma, a doctrine of deeds, a doctrine of energy.

original: “Svākkhāte, bhikkhave, dhammavinaye yo ca samādapeti yañca samādapeti yo ca samādapito tathattāya paṭipajjati sabbe te bahuṁ puññaṁ pasavanti.
analyzed: su ākkhāte bhikkhave dhamma vinaye yaḥ ca samādapeti yat ca samādapeti yaḥ ca samādapito tathattāya paṭipajjati sabbe te bahum puññam pasavanti
translated: “When the Dhamma and Discipline is well proclaimed, those who encourage others to go forth and those who go forth—all make much merit.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Svākkhātattā, bhikkhave, dhammassā”ti.
analyzed: su ākkhāta ttā bhikkhave dhammassa ati
translated: Because the Dhamma is well proclaimed.”

original: “Durakkhāte, bhikkhave, dhammavinaye dāyakena mattā jānitabbā, no paṭiggāhakena.
analyzed: durakkhāte bhikkhave dhamma vinaye dāyakena mattā jānitabbā no paṭiggāhakena
translated: “When the Dhamma and Discipline is badly proclaimed, the giver should know moderation, not the receiver.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Durakkhātattā, bhikkhave, dhammassā”ti.
analyzed: durakkhāta ttā bhikkhave dhammassa ati
translated: Because the Dhamma is badly proclaimed.”

original: “Svākkhāte, bhikkhave, dhammavinaye paṭiggāhakena mattā jānitabbā, no dāyakena.
analyzed: su ākkhāte bhikkhave dhamma vinaye paṭiggāhakena mattā jānitabbā no dāyakena
translated: “When the Dhamma and Discipline is well proclaimed, the receiver should know moderation, not the giver.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Svākkhātattā, bhikkhave, dhammassā”ti.
analyzed: su ākkhāta ttā bhikkhave dhammassa ati
translated: Because the Dhamma is well proclaimed.”

original: “Durakkhāte, bhikkhave, dhammavinaye yo āraddhavīriyo so dukkhaṁ viharati.
analyzed: durakkhāte bhikkhave dhamma vinaye yaḥ āraddha vīriyo so dukkham viharati
translated: “When the Dhamma and Discipline is badly proclaimed, one who is energetic finds it hard going.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Durakkhātattā, bhikkhave, dhammassā”ti.
analyzed: durakkhāta ttā bhikkhave dhammassa ati
translated: Because the Dhamma is badly proclaimed.”

original: “Svākkhāte, bhikkhave, dhammavinaye yo kusīto so dukkhaṁ viharati.
analyzed: su ākkhāte bhikkhave dhamma vinaye yaḥ kusītaḥ saḥ dukkham viharati
translated: “When the Dhamma and Discipline is well proclaimed, one who is lazy finds it hard going.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Svākkhātattā, bhikkhave, dhammassā”ti.
analyzed: su ākkhāta ttā bhikkhave dhammassa ati
translated: Because the Dhamma is well-expounded.”

original: “Durakkhāte, bhikkhave, dhammavinaye yo kusīto so sukhaṁ viharati.
analyzed: durakkhāte bhikkhave dhamma vinaye yaḥ kusītaḥ so sukham viharati
translated: “Monks, in a poorly-expounded Dhamma and Discipline one who is lazy lives at ease.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: And why is that?

original: Durakkhātattā, bhikkhave, dhammassā”ti.
analyzed: durakkhāta ttā bhikkhave dhammassa ati
translated: Because the Dhamma is poorly-expounded.”

original: “Svākkhāte, bhikkhave, dhammavinaye yo āraddhavīriyo so sukhaṁ viharati.
analyzed: su ākkhāte bhikkhave dhamma vinaye yaḥ āraddha vīriyo so sukham viharati
translated: “Monks, in a well-expounded Dhamma and Discipline one who is energetic lives at ease.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: And why is that?

original: Svākkhātattā, bhikkhave, dhammassā”ti.
analyzed: su ākkhāta ttā bhikkhave dhammassa ati
translated: Because the Dhamma is well-expounded.”

original: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, appamattakopi gūtho duggandho hoti;
analyzed: seyyathā api bhikkhave appamattakaḥ api gūthaḥ duggandhaḥ hoti
translated: “Monks, even a little excrement has a bad smell.

original: evamevaṁ kho ahaṁ, bhikkhave, appamattakampi bhavaṁ na vaṇṇemi, antamaso accharāsaṅghātamattampi”.
analyzed: evam evam kho aha bhikkhave appamattakam pi bhavam na vaṇṇemi antamasaḥ accharā saṅghāta mattam pi
translated: So too, I don’t recommend even a little of the life-process, not even for as long as a snap of the fingers.”

original: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, appamattakampi muttaṁ duggandhaṁ hoti … appamattakopi kheḷo duggandho hoti … appamattakopi pubbo duggandho hoti … appamattakampi lohitaṁ duggandhaṁ hoti;
