analyzed: seyyathā api bhikkhave appamattakam pi muttam duggandham hoti appamattakaḥ api kheḷaḥ duggandhaḥ hoti appamattakaḥ api pubbaḥ duggandhaḥ hoti appamattakam pi lohitam duggandham hoti
translated: “Monks, even a little urine has a bad smell … even a little spit has a bad smell … even a little mucus has a bad smell … even a little blood has a bad smell …

original: evamevaṁ kho ahaṁ, bhikkhave, appamattakampi bhavaṁ na vaṇṇemi, antamaso accharāsaṅghātamattampi”.🔽Vaggo tatiyo.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 1
analyzed: evam evam kho aha bhikkhave appamattakam pi bhavam na vaṇṇemi antamasaḥ accharā saṅghāta mattam pi  vaggo tatiyaḥ  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: In the same way, I don’t condone even a little of becoming, even for the time of a finger-snap.”🔽The third sub-chapter on the simile of the raft is finished.🔽The Numerical Discourses

original: 27. Catutthavagga
analyzed: catuttha vagga
translated: 4. The fourth sub-chapter

original: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, appamattakaṁ imasmiṁ jambudīpe ārāmarāmaṇeyyakaṁ vanarāmaṇeyyakaṁ bhūmirāmaṇeyyakaṁ pokkharaṇirāmaṇeyyakaṁ;
analyzed: seyyathā api bhikkhave appamattakam imasmin jambudīpe ārāma rāmaṇeyyakam vana rāmaṇeyyakam bhūmi rāmaṇeyyakam pokkharaṇi rāmaṇeyyaka
translated: “Monks, the delightful parks, groves, lakes, and lotus ponds in this Rose Apple Isle are few.

original: atha kho etadeva bahutaraṁ yadidaṁ ukkūlavikūlaṁ nadīviduggaṁ khāṇukaṇṭakaṭṭhānaṁ pabbatavisamaṁ;
analyzed: atha kho etat eva bahutaram yat idam ukkūla vikūlam nadī viduggam khāṇu kaṇṭaka ṭṭhānam pabbata visama
translated: The rough and uneven terrain, with its rivers, ravines, stumps, thorns, and uneven rocky outcrops, is much more common.

original: evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye thalajā, atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye odakā.
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakāḥ te sattāḥ ye thala jāḥ atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye odakā
translated: In the same way, the beings who are born on dry land are few, while those who are born in the water are much more numerous.

original: … Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye manussesu paccājāyanti;
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakāḥ te sattāḥ ye manussesu paccājāyanti
translated: … In the same way, the beings who are born as humans are few,

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye aññatra manussehi paccājāyanti.
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye aññatra manussehi paccājāyanti
translated: while those who are born elsewhere are much more numerous.

original: … Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye majjhimesu janapadesu paccājāyanti;
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakāḥ te sattāḥ ye majjhimesu janapadesu paccājāyanti
translated: … In the same way, the beings who are born in the central countries are few,

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye paccantimesu janapadesu paccājāyanti aviññātāresu milakkhesu.
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye paccantimesu janapadesu paccājāyanti a viññātāresu milakkhesu
translated: There are more beings who are reborn in the border regions among ignorant barbarians who don’t understand when they’re spoken to.

original: … Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye paññavanto ajaḷā aneḷamūgā paṭibalā subhāsitadubbhāsitassa atthamaññātuṁ;
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakā te sattā ye paññavantaḥ ajaḷāḥ an eḷa mūgāḥ paṭibalā subhāsita dubbhāsitassa attham aññātu
translated: “In the same way, monks, there are fewer beings who are wise, not dull, not confused, and able to understand the meaning of what is well-said and badly-said,

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye duppaññā jaḷā eḷamūgā na paṭibalā subhāsitadubbhāsitassa atthamaññātuṁ.
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye duppaññāḥ jaḷāḥ eḷamūgāḥ na paṭibalā subhāsita dubbhāsitassa attham aññātu
translated: while there are more beings who are unwise, dull, confused, and unable to understand the meaning of what is well-said and badly-said.

original: … Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye ariyena paññācakkhunā samannāgatā;
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakā te sattāḥ ye ariyena paññā cakkhunā samannāgatā
translated: “In the same way, monks, there are fewer beings who have the noble eye of wisdom,

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye avijjāgatā sammūḷhā.
analyzed: atha khalu ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye a vid āgatā sammūḍhā
translated: while there are more beings who are ignorant and confused.

original: … Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye labhanti tathāgataṁ dassanāya;
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakāḥ te sattāḥ ye labhanti tathāgatam dassanāya
translated: “In the same way, monks, there are fewer beings who get to see a Buddha,

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye na labhanti tathāgataṁ dassanāya.
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye na labhanti tathāgatam dassanāya
translated: while there are more beings who don’t get to see a Buddha.

original: … Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye labhanti tathāgatappaveditaṁ dhammavinayaṁ savanāya;
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakāḥ te sattāḥ ye labhanti tathāgata paveditam dhamma vinayam savanāya
translated: “In the same way, monks, there are fewer beings who get to hear the Teaching and training proclaimed by the Buddha,

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye na labhanti tathāgatappaveditaṁ dhammavinayaṁ savanāya.
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye na labhanti tathāgata ppaveditam dhamma vinayam savanāya
translated: but there are many more beings who do not get to hear the Teaching and training proclaimed by the Buddha.

original: … Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye sutvā dhammaṁ dhārenti;
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakāḥ te sattāḥ ye sutvā dhammam dhārenti
translated: “In the same way, monks, there are fewer beings who remember the Teaching they have heard,

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye sutvā dhammaṁ na dhārenti.
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye sutvā dhammam na dhārenti
translated: but there are many more beings who do not remember the Teaching they have heard.

original: … Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye dhātānaṁ dhammānaṁ atthaṁ upaparikkhanti;
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakāḥ te sattāḥ ye dhātānam dhammānam attham upaparikkhanti
translated: “In the same way, monks, there are fewer beings who investigate the meaning of the teachings they have remembered,

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye dhātānaṁ dhammānaṁ atthaṁ na upaparikkhanti.
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye dhātānam dhammānam attham na upaparikkhanti
translated: but there are many more beings who do not investigate the meaning of the teachings they have remembered.

original: … Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammaṁ paṭipajjanti;
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakāḥ te sattāḥ ye attha maññāya dhamma maññāya dhamma anudhammam paṭipajjanti
translated: “In the same way, monks, there are fewer beings who, having understood the meaning and the Teaching, practice in accordance with the Teaching,

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammaṁ na paṭipajjanti.
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye attha maññāya dhamma maññāya dhamma anudhammam na paṭipajjanti
translated: but there are many more beings who, having understood the meaning and the Teaching, do not practice in accordance with the Teaching.

original: … Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye saṁvejaniyesu ṭhānesu saṁvijjanti;
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakāḥ te sattāḥ ye savejaniyesu ṭhānesu savijjanti
translated: “In the same way, monks, there are fewer beings who are affected by what is worthy of being affected by,

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye saṁvejaniyesu ṭhānesu na saṁvijjanti.🔽… Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye saṁviggā yoniso padahanti;
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye savejaniyesu ṭhānesu na savijjanti  evam evam kho bhikkhave appakāḥ te sattāḥ ye saviggāḥ yonisas padahanti
translated: There are many more beings who are not horrified by what is horrifying.

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye saṁviggā yoniso na padahanti.🔽… Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye vavassaggārammaṇaṁ karitvā labhanti samādhiṁ labhanti cittassekaggataṁ;
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye sa viggāḥ yonisaḥ na padahanti  evam evam kho bhikkhave appakāḥ te sattāḥ ye vavassagga ārammaṇam karitvā labhanti samādhim labhanti cittassa ekagga ta
translated: “In the same way, monks, there are many more beings who, being horrified, do not make a thorough investigation,🔽than who, being horrified, make a thorough investigation.

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye vavassaggārammaṇaṁ karitvā na labhanti samādhiṁ na labhanti cittassekaggataṁ.🔽… Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye annaggarasaggānaṁ lābhino;
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye vavassagga ārammaṇam karitvā na labhanti samādhim na labhanti cittassa ekagga tā  evam evam kho bhikkhave appakāḥ te sattāḥ ye anna aggara saggānam lābhinaḥ
translated: “In the same way, monks, there are many more beings who, taking non-clinging as the object, do not attain concentration, do not attain one-pointedness of mind,🔽than who, taking non-clinging as the object, attain concentration, attain one-pointedness of mind.

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye annaggarasaggānaṁ na lābhino, uñchena kapālābhatena yāpenti.
analyzed: atha khalu ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye na lābhinaḥ uñchena kapālābhatena yāpenti
translated: “In the same way, monks, there are many more beings who do not obtain the best food and delicacies,🔽who get by on scraps from a dish of rice and a dish of curry.🔽“In the same way, monks, there are many more beings who do not obtain the taste of the meaning, the taste of the Dhamma, the taste of liberation,

original: … Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye attharasassa dhammarasassa vimuttirasassa lābhino;
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakā te sattā ye attha rasassa dhamma rasassa vimutti rasassa lābhinaḥ
translated: “Monks, those beings who are human are few,

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye attharasassa dhammarasassa vimuttirasassa na lābhino.
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye attha rasassa dhamma rasassa vimutti rasassa na lābhinaḥ
translated: But there are many more beings who don’t obtain the essence of meaning, the essence of the Teaching, or the essence of freedom.

original: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, evaṁ sikkhitabbaṁ:
analyzed: tasmāt iha bhikkhave evam sikkhitabba
translated: Therefore, monks, you should train yourselves:

original: ‘attharasassa dhammarasassa vimuttirasassa lābhino bhavissāmā’ti.
analyzed: attha rasassa dhamma rasassa vimutti rasassa lābhinaḥ bhavissāma ati
translated: ‘We will obtain the essence of meaning, the essence of the Teaching, and the essence of freedom.’

original: Evañhi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabban”ti.
analyzed: evam hi vaḥ bhikkhave sikkhitabbanti
translated: That’s how you should train.”

original: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, appamattakaṁ imasmiṁ jambudīpe ārāmarāmaṇeyyakaṁ vanarāmaṇeyyakaṁ bhūmirāmaṇeyyakaṁ pokkharaṇirāmaṇeyyakaṁ;
analyzed: seyyathā api bhikkhave appamattakam imasmin jambudīpe ārāma rāmaṇeyyakam vana rāmaṇeyyakam bhūmi rāmaṇeyyakam pokkharaṇi rāmaṇeyyaka
translated: “Monks, the delightful parks, groves, lakes, and lotus ponds in this Rose Apple Island are few.

original: atha kho etadeva bahutaraṁ yadidaṁ ukkūlavikūlaṁ nadīviduggaṁ khāṇukaṇṭakaṭṭhānaṁ pabbatavisamaṁ.
analyzed: atha kho etat eva bahutaram yat idam ukkūla vikūlam nadī viduggam khāṇu kaṇṭaka ṭṭhānam pabbata visama
translated: The rough and uneven terrain, with its rivers, ravines, stumps, thorns, and uneven rocks, is much more common.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye manussā cutā manussesu paccājāyanti,🔽atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye manussā cutā niraye paccājāyanti …pe… tiracchānayoniyā
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakā te sattā ye manussā cutāḥ manussesu paccājāyanti  atha kho ete iva sattā bahutarā ye manussā cutā niraye paccājāyanti pe tiracchāna yoniyā
translated: In the same way, there are few beings who, when they die as humans, are reborn as humans.

original: paccājāyanti …pe… pettivisaye paccājāyanti”.
analyzed: paccājāyanti pe pettivisaye paccājāyanti
translated: But there are many beings who, when they die as humans, are reborn in hell, as animals, or in the ghost realm.”

original: … Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye manussā cutā devesu paccājāyanti;
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakā te sattā ye manussā cutā devesu paccājāyanti
translated: … In the same way, monks, few are those beings who, having passed away as human beings, are reborn among the gods;

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye manussā cutā niraye paccājāyanti … tiracchānayoniyā paccājāyanti … pettivisaye paccājāyanti.
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye manussā cutā niraye paccājāyanti tiracchāna yoniyā paccājāyanti pettivisaye paccājāyanti
translated: but many are those beings who, having passed away as human beings, are reborn in hell … are reborn in the animal realm … are reborn in the realm of hungry ghosts.

original: … Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye devā cutā devesu paccājāyanti;
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakā te sattā ye devā cutā devesu paccājāyanti
translated: … In the same way, monks, few are those beings who, having passed away as gods, are reborn among the gods;

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye devā cutā niraye paccājāyanti … tiracchānayoniyā paccājāyanti … pettivisaye paccājāyanti.
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye devā cutā niraye paccājāyanti tiracchāna yoniyā paccājāyanti pettivisaye paccājāyanti
translated: but many are those beings who, having passed away as gods, are reborn in hell … are reborn in the animal realm … are reborn in the realm of hungry ghosts.

original: … Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye devā cutā manussesu paccājāyanti;
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakā te sattā ye devā cutāḥ manussesu paccājāyanti
translated: … In the same way, monks, few are those beings who, having passed away as gods, are reborn as human beings;

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye devā cutā niraye paccājāyanti … tiracchānayoniyā paccājāyanti … pettivisaye paccājāyanti.
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye devā cutā niraye paccājāyanti tiracchāna yoniyā paccājāyanti pettivisaye paccājāyanti
translated: but many are those beings who, having passed away as gods, are reborn in hell … are reborn in the animal realm … are reborn in the realm of hungry ghosts.

original: … Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye nirayā cutā manussesu paccājāyanti;
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakā te sattā ye nirayā cutāḥ manussesu paccājāyanti
translated: … In the same way, monks, few are those beings who, having passed away from hell, are reborn as human beings;

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye nirayā cutā niraye paccājāyanti … tiracchānayoniyā paccājāyanti … pettivisaye paccājāyanti.
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye nirayā cutā niraye paccājāyanti tiracchāna yoniyā paccājāyanti pettivisaye paccājāyanti
translated: but there are more beings who, when they die, are reborn in hell, or in the animal realm, or in the ghost realm.

original: … Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye nirayā cutā devesu paccājāyanti;
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakā te sattā ye nirayā cutāḥ devesu paccājāyanti
translated: … In the same way, monks, there are fewer beings who, when they die, are reborn in the realm of the gods,

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye nirayā cutā niraye paccājāyanti … tiracchānayoniyā paccājāyanti … pettivisaye paccājāyanti.
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye nirayā cutā niraye paccājāyanti tiracchāna yoniyā paccājāyanti pettivisaye paccājāyanti
translated: but there are more beings who, when they die, are reborn in hell, or in the animal realm, or in the ghost realm.

original: … Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye tiracchānayoniyā cutā manussesu paccājāyanti;
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakā te sattā ye tiracchāna yoniyā cutāḥ manussesu paccājāyanti
translated: … In the same way, monks, there are fewer beings who, when they die, are reborn in the human realm,

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye tiracchānayoniyā cutā niraye paccājāyanti … tiracchānayoniyā paccājāyanti … pettivisaye paccājāyanti.
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye tiracchāna yoniyā cutāḥ niraye paccājāyanti tiracchāna yoniyā paccājāyanti pettivisaye paccājāyanti
translated: but there are more beings who, when they die, are reborn in hell, or in the animal realm, or in the ghost realm.

original: … Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye tiracchānayoniyā cutā devesu paccājāyanti;
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakāḥ te sattāḥ ye tiracchāna yoniyā cutāḥ devesu paccājāyanti
translated: … In the same way, monks, there are fewer beings who, when they die, are reborn in the realm of the gods,

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye tiracchānayoniyā cutā niraye paccājāyanti … tiracchānayoniyā paccājāyanti … pettivisaye paccājāyanti.
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye tiracchāna yoniyā cutāḥ niraye paccājāyanti tiracchāna yoniyā paccājāyanti pettivisaye paccājāyanti
translated: The number of beings who pass away from the animal realm and are reborn in hell, in the animal realm, or in the ghost realm is greater.

original: … Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye pettivisayā cutā manussesu paccājāyanti;
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakā te sattā ye petti visayā cutāḥ manussesu paccājāyanti
translated: … So too, bhikkhus, are the beings who pass away from the ghost realm and are reborn in the human realm.

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye pettivisayā cutā niraye paccājāyanti … tiracchānayoniyā paccājāyanti … pettivisaye paccājāyanti.
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye pettivisayā cutā niraye paccājāyanti tiracchāna yoniyā paccājāyanti pettivisaye paccājāyanti
translated: The number of beings who pass away from the ghost realm and are reborn in hell, in the animal realm, or in the ghost realm is greater.

original: … Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye pettivisayā cutā devesu paccājāyanti;
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave appakāḥ te sattāḥ ye petti visayā cutāḥ devesu paccājāyanti
translated: … So too, bhikkhus, are the beings who pass away from the ghost realm and are reborn in the deva realm.

original: atha kho eteva sattā bahutarā ye pettivisayā cutā niraye paccājāyanti … tiracchānayoniyā paccājāyanti … pettivisaye paccājāyan”ti.🔽vaggo catuttho.
analyzed: atha kho ete iva sattāḥ bahutarāḥ ye pettivisayā cutā niraye paccājāyanti tiracchāna yoniyā paccājāyanti pettivisaye paccājāyanti  vaggo catutthaḥ
translated: The number of beings who pass away from the ghost realm and are reborn in hell, in the animal realm, or in the ghost realm is greater.”

original: (Jambudīpapeyyālo niṭṭhito.)
translated: The fourth sub-chapter on the continent of Jambu is finished.🔽The continent of Jambu is finished.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 1
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of Elevens

original: 28. Pasādakaradhammavagga
translated: The Chapter on Things That Inspire Complete Conviction

original: “Addhamidaṁ, bhikkhave, lābhānaṁ yadidaṁ āraññikattaṁ …pe…
analyzed: addham idam bhikkhave lābhānam yat idam āraññika ttam pe
translated: wearing rag-robes …

original: piṇḍapātikattaṁ …🔽paṁsukūlikattaṁ …🔽tecīvarikattaṁ …🔽dhammakathikattaṁ …🔽vinayadharattaṁ …🔽bāhusaccaṁ …
analyzed: piṇḍapātikattam  pasukūlikattam  tecīvarikattam  dhamma kathika ttam  vinaya dharattam  bāhusaccam
translated: having only three robes …🔽being a speaker of Dhamma …🔽being a master of the Vinaya …

original: thāvareyyaṁ …🔽ākappasampadā …
analyzed: thāvareyyam  ākappa sampadā
translated: being learned …🔽being an elder …🔽having good friends …

original: parivārasampadā …
analyzed: parivāra sampadā
translated: having good companions …

original: mahāparivāratā …🔽kolaputti …🔽vaṇṇapokkharatā …
analyzed: mahā parivāra tā  kolaputti  vaṇṇa pokkhara tā
translated: having a large retinue …🔽being a son of a good family …🔽having good complexion …

original: kalyāṇavākkaraṇatā …
analyzed: kalyāṇa vāc karaṇa tā
translated: being a good speaker …

original: appicchatā …
analyzed: appicchatā
translated: being content …

original: appābādhatā”ti.
analyzed: appā ābādhata iti
translated: being free from illness.”

original: (Soḷasa pasādakaradhammā niṭṭhitā.)
analyzed: soḷasa pasāda kara dhammā niṭṭhitā
translated: (Sixteen things that cause confidence are finished.)

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 1
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of the Elevens

original: 29. Aparaaccharāsaṅghātavagga🔽“Accharāsaṅghātamattampi ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ bhāveti, ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave:
analyzed: apara accharā saṅghāta vagga  accharā saṅghāta mattam pi ce bhikkhave bhikkhu paṭhamam jhānam bhāveti ayam vuccati bhikkhave
translated: The Chapter on a Finger Snap

original: ‘bhikkhu arittajjhāno viharati, satthusāsanakaro ovādapatikaro, amoghaṁ raṭṭhapiṇḍaṁ bhuñjati’.🔽Ko pana vādo ye naṁ bahulīkarontī”ti.
analyzed: bhikkhu aritta jhānaḥ viharati satthu sāsana karaḥ ovāda patikaraḥ amogham raṭṭha piṇḍam bhuñjati  kaḥ pana vādaḥ ye nam bahulīkaronti iti
translated: “Monks, if a monk develops the first absorption, which is without form and has a limited object, to the extent that he attains the ability to touch with his body the devas who delight in creation and last for an eon, then he is called a monk who has development of concentration as a support, who has attained the devas’ supreme eyesight, and who has touched with his body the devas who delight in creation and last for an eon.🔽“Monks, if a monk develops the first absorption, which is without form and has a limited object, to the extent that he attains the ability to touch with his body the devas who delight in creation and last for an eon, then he is called a monk who has development of concentration as a support, who has attained the devas’ supreme eyesight, and who has touched with his body the devas who delight in creation and last for an eon.

original: “Accharāsaṅghātamattampi ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ bhāveti …pe…
analyzed: accharā saṅghāta mattam pi ce bhikkhave bhikkhu dutiyam jhānam bhāveti pe
translated: “Monks, if a monk develops the second absorption … the third absorption … the fourth absorption …

original: tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ bhāveti …pe…
analyzed: tatiyam jhānam
translated: he develops the third jhāna…

original: catutthaṁ jhānaṁ bhāveti …pe…🔽mettaṁ cetovimuttiṁ bhāveti …pe…
analyzed: catuttham jhānam bhāveti pe  mettam cetaḥ vimuttim bhāveti pe
translated: he develops the fourth jhāna…🔽he develops the mind-deliverance of loving-kindness…

original: karuṇaṁ cetovimuttiṁ bhāveti …pe…🔽muditaṁ cetovimuttiṁ bhāveti …pe…
analyzed: karuṇam cetaḥ vimuttim bhāveti pe  muditam cetaḥ vimuttim bhāveti pe
translated: he develops the mind-deliverance of compassion…🔽he develops the mind-deliverance of gladness…

original: upekkhaṁ cetovimuttiṁ bhāveti …pe….
analyzed: upekkham cetaḥ vimuttim bhāveti pe
translated: he develops the mind-deliverance of equanimity…

original: Kāye kāyānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ …pe…
analyzed: kāye kāya anupassī viharati ātāpī sampajānaḥ satimā vineyya loke abhijjhā domanassam pe
translated: He dwells contemplating (the nature of) the body in the body, ardent, clearly comprehending, unified, with complete mindfulness, having removed covetousness and displeasure in regard to the world.

original: vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharati …
analyzed: vedanāsu vedanā anupassī viharati
translated: He dwells contemplating (the nature of) feelings in feelings,

original: citte cittānupassī viharati …
analyzed: citte citta anupassī viharati
translated: he dwells contemplating (the nature of) the mind in the mind,

original: dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.🔽Anuppannānaṁ pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ anuppādāya chandaṁ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṁ ārabhati cittaṁ paggaṇhāti padahati;
analyzed: dhammesu dhamma anupassī viharati ātāpī sampajānaḥ satimā vineyya loke abhijjhā domanassa  an uppannānam pāpakānam akusalānam dhammānam an uppādāya chandam janeti vāyamati vīriyam ārabhati cittam paggaṇhāti padahati
translated: he dwells contemplating (the nature of) things in (various) things, ardent, clearly comprehending, unified, with complete mindfulness, having removed covetousness and displeasure in regard to the world.🔽He generates desire for the non-arising of bad and unwholesome things that have not yet arisen, he makes an effort, arouses energy, applies his mind, and strives;

original: uppannānaṁ pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya chandaṁ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṁ ārabhati cittaṁ paggaṇhāti padahati.
analyzed: uppannānam pāpakānam akusalānam dhammānam pahānāya chandam janeti vāyamati vīriyam ārabhati cittam paggaṇhāti padahati
translated: he generates desire for the abandoning of bad and unwholesome things that have already arisen, he makes an effort, arouses energy, applies his mind, and strives.

original: Anuppannānaṁ kusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ uppādāya chandaṁ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṁ ārabhati cittaṁ paggaṇhāti padahati;
analyzed: anuppannānam kusalānam dhammānam uppādāya chandam janeti vāyamati vīriyam ārabhati cittam paggaṇhāti padahati
translated: He generates desire for the arising of unarisen wholesome states. He makes an effort, arouses energy, applies his mind, and strives.🔽He generates desire for the continuance, non-disappearance, increase, plenitude, development, and fulfilment of arisen wholesome states. He makes an effort, arouses energy, applies his mind, and strives.

original: uppannānaṁ kusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ ṭhitiyā asammosāya bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya bhāvanāya pāripūriyā chandaṁ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṁ ārabhati cittaṁ paggaṇhāti padahati.🔽Chandasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṁ iddhipādaṁ bhāveti …🔽vīriyasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṁ iddhipādaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: uppannānam kusalānam dhammānam ṭhitiyāḥ asammosāya bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya bhāvanāya pāripūriyā chandam janeti vāyamati vīriyam ārabhati cittam paggaṇhāti padahati  chanda samādhi padhāna saṅkhāra samanna āgatam iddhipādam bhāva iti  vīriya samādhi padhāna saṅkhāra samannāgatam iddhipādam bhāva iti
translated: He develops the basis for spiritual power that possesses concentration due to desire and the volitional formations of striving.🔽He develops the basis for spiritual power that possesses concentration due to energy and the volitional formations of striving.

original: cittasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṁ iddhipādaṁ bhāveti …🔽vīmaṁsāsamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṁ iddhipādaṁ bhāveti ….
analyzed: citta samādhi padhāna saṅkhāra samannāgatam iddhipādam bhāva iti  iddhipādam bhāva iti
translated: He develops the basis for spiritual power that possesses concentration due to mind and the volitional formations of striving.🔽He develops the basis for spiritual power that possesses concentration due to investigation and the volitional formations of striving.

original: Saddhindriyaṁ bhāveti …🔽vīriyindriyaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: sat hi indriyam bhāva iti  vīriyindriyam bhāva iti
translated: He develops the faculty of faith.🔽He develops the faculty of energy.

original: satindriyaṁ bhāveti …🔽samādhindriyaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: sati indriyam  samādhi indriyam bhāva iti
translated: He develops the faculty of mindfulness.🔽He develops the faculty of concentration.

original: paññindriyaṁ bhāveti ….🔽Saddhābalaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: paññindriyam bhāveti  saddhā balam bhāva iti
translated: He develops the faculty of wisdom.🔽He develops the strength of faith.

original: vīriyabalaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: vīriya balam bhāva iti
translated: He develops the strength of energy.

original: satibalaṁ bhāveti …🔽samādhibalaṁ bhāveti …🔽paññābalaṁ bhāveti ….🔽Satisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: sati balam bhāva iti  samādhi balam bhāva iti  paññā balam bhāveti  sati sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti
translated: He develops the strength of mindfulness …

original: dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāveti …🔽vīriyasambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāveti …🔽pītisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti  vīriya sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti  pīti sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti
translated: the strength of concentration …🔽the strength of wisdom …🔽He develops the enlightenment factor of mindfulness …

original: passaddhisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāveti …🔽samādhisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: passaddhi sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti  samādhi sambojjhaṅgam bhāva iti
translated: the enlightenment factor of investigation of phenomena …🔽the enlightenment factor of energy …

original: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāveti ….🔽Sammādiṭṭhiṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: upekkhā sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti  sammādiṭṭhim bhāveti
translated: the enlightenment factor of rapture …🔽the enlightenment factor of calm …

original: sammāsaṅkappaṁ bhāveti …🔽sammāvācaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: sammā saṅkappam bhāveti  sammāvācam bhāva iti
translated: the enlightenment factor of concentration …🔽the enlightenment factor of equanimity …🔽He develops right view …

original: sammākammantaṁ bhāveti …🔽sammāājīvaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: sammākammantam bhāva iti  sammāājīvam bhāva iti
translated: right thought …🔽right speech …

original: sammāvāyāmaṁ bhāveti …🔽sammāsatiṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: sammāvāyāmam bhāva iti  sammāsatim bhāva iti
translated: right action …🔽right livelihood …🔽right effort …🔽right mindfulness …

original: sammāsamādhiṁ bhāveti ….
analyzed: sammā samādhim bhāva iti
translated: right concentration …

original: Ajjhattaṁ rūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati parittāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni.
analyzed: ajjhattam rūpa saññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati parittāni suvaṇṇa dubbaṇṇāni
translated: Perceiving forms internally, he sees external forms that are limited, beautiful or ugly.

original: Tāni abhibhuyya:
analyzed: tāni abhibhuyya
translated: Having overcome them, he is aware of it thus:

original: ‘jānāmi passāmī’ti—
analyzed: jānāmi passāmi iti
translated: ‘I know and see.’

original: evaṁsaññī hoti.
analyzed: eva saññī hoti
translated: He is thus concentrated.

original: … ajjhattaṁ rūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati appamāṇāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni.
analyzed: ajjhattam rūpa saññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati appamāṇāni suvaṇṇa dubbaṇṇāni
translated: … Perceiving forms internally, he sees external forms that are unlimited, beautiful or ugly.

original: Tāni abhibhuyya:
analyzed: tāni abhibhuyya
translated: Having overcome them, he is aware of it thus:

original: ‘jānāmi passāmī’ti—
analyzed: jānāmi passāmi iti
translated: ‘I know and see’

original: evaṁsaññī hoti.
analyzed: eva saññī hoti
translated: he has that perception.

original: … ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati parittāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni.
analyzed: ajjhattam arūpa saññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati parittāni suvaṇṇa dubbaṇṇāni
translated: … Not perceiving forms internally, he sees forms externally that are limited, beautiful and ugly.

original: Tāni abhibhuyya:
analyzed: tāni abhibhuyya
translated: Having mastered them,

original: ‘jānāmi passāmī’ti—
analyzed: jānāmi passāmi iti
translated: he thinks: ‘I know and see’

original: evaṁsaññī hoti.
analyzed: eva saññī hoti
translated: he has that perception.

original: … ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati appamāṇāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni.
analyzed: ajjhattam arūpa saññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati appamāṇāni suvaṇṇa dubbaṇṇāni
translated: … Not perceiving forms internally, he sees forms externally that are unlimited, beautiful and ugly.

original: Tāni abhibhuyya:
analyzed: tāni abhibhuyya
translated: Having mastered them,

original: ‘jānāmi passāmī’ti—
analyzed: jānāmi passāmi iti
translated: he thinks: ‘I know and see’

original: evaṁsaññī hoti.
analyzed: eva saññī hoti
translated: he has that perception.

original: … ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati nīlāni nīlavaṇṇāni nīlanidassanāni nīlanibhāsāni.
analyzed: ajjhattam arūpa saññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati nīlāni nīla vaṇṇāni nīla nidassanāni nīla nibhāsāni
translated: … Not perceiving forms internally, he sees forms externally that are blue, of blue colour, of blue lustre.

original: Tāni abhibhuyya:
analyzed: tāni abhibhuyya
translated: Having mastered them,

original: ‘jānāmi passāmī’ti—
analyzed: jānāmi passāmi iti
translated: he thinks: ‘I know and see’

original: evaṁsaññī hoti.
analyzed: eva saññī hoti
translated: he has that perception.

original: … ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati pītāni pītavaṇṇāni pītanidassanāni pītanibhāsāni.
analyzed: ajjhattam arūpa saññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati pītāni pīta vaṇṇāni pīta nidassanāni pīta nibhāsāni
translated: … Not perceiving forms internally, he sees forms externally that are yellow, of yellow colour, of yellow lustre.

original: Tāni abhibhuyya:
analyzed: tāni abhibhuyya
translated: Having mastered them,

original: ‘jānāmi passāmī’ti—
analyzed: jānāmi passāmi iti
translated: he thinks: ‘I know and see’

original: evaṁsaññī hoti.
analyzed: eva saññī hoti
translated: he has that perception.

original: … ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati lohitakāni lohitakavaṇṇāni lohitakanidassanāni lohitakanibhāsāni.
analyzed: ajjhattam arūpa saññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati lohitakāni lohitaka vaṇṇāni lohitaka nidassanāni lohitaka nibhāsāni
translated: … not having form in mind, he sees forms that are red, of red colour, of red lustre.

original: Tāni abhibhuyya:🔽‘jānāmi passāmī’ti—
analyzed: tāni abhibhuyya  jānāmi passāmi iti
translated: Having mastered them,

original: evaṁsaññī hoti.
analyzed: eva saññī hoti
translated: he is aware that he knows and sees.

original: … ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati odātāni odātavaṇṇāni odātanidassanāni odātanibhāsāni.
analyzed: ajjhattam arūpa saññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati odātāni odāta vaṇṇāni odāta nidassanāni odāta nibhāsāni
translated: … not having form in mind, he sees forms that are white, of white colour, of white lustre.

original: Tāni abhibhuyya:🔽‘jānāmi passāmī’ti—
analyzed: tāni abhibhuyya  jānāmi passāmi iti
translated: Having mastered them,

original: evaṁsaññī hoti.🔽Rūpī rūpāni passati …
analyzed: eva saññī hoti  rūpī rūpāni passati
translated: he is aware that he knows and sees.🔽He sees forms while being form.

original: ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati …
analyzed: ajjhattam a rūpa saññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati
translated: … not having form in mind, he sees forms.

original: subhanteva adhimutto hoti …🔽sabbaso rūpasaññānaṁ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṁ atthaṅgamā nānattasaññānaṁ amanasikārā ananto ākāsoti ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati …
analyzed: subhantā iva adhimutto hoti  sabbaso rūpa saññānam samatikkamā paṭigha saññānam atthaṅgamā nānatta saññānam amanasikārā anantaḥ ākāsaḥ ti ākāsānañcāyatanam upasampajja viharati
translated: … he is intent only on the thought that they are beautiful.🔽… he enters and remains in the dimension of the infinitude of space …

original: sabbaso ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma anantaṁ viññāṇanti viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati …
analyzed: sabbaso ākāsānañcāyatanam samatikkamma anantam viññāṇanti viññāṇañcāyatanam upasampajja viharati
translated: … he enters and remains in the dimension of the infinitude of consciousness …

original: sabbaso viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma natthi kiñcīti ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati …🔽sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ samatikkamma nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati …
analyzed: sabbasas viññāṇañca āyatanam samatikkamma na atthi kiñci iti ākiñcaññāyatanam upasampajja viharati  sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanam samatikkamma nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam upasampajja viharati
translated: They completely surmount the dimension of the infinitude of consciousness. Aware that ‘there is nothing at all,’ they enter and remain in the dimension of nothingness. …🔽They completely surmount the dimension of nothingness. Aware that ‘this is the end of the mental body,’ they enter and remain in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception. …

original: sabbaso nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ samatikkamma saññāvedayitanirodhaṁ upasampajja viharati ….🔽Pathavikasiṇaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: sabbasas nevasaññā nāsañña āyatanam samatikkamma saññā vedayita nirodham upasampajja viharati  pathavikasiṇam bhāva iti
translated: They completely surmount the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception. They enter and remain in the cessation of perception and feeling. …🔽They develop the earth kasiṇa …

original: āpokasiṇaṁ bhāveti …🔽tejokasiṇaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: āpokasiṇam bhāva iti  tejaḥ kasiṇam bhāva iti
translated: the water kasiṇa …🔽the fire kasiṇa …

original: vāyokasiṇaṁ bhāveti …🔽nīlakasiṇaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: vāyokasiṇam bhāva iti  nīla kasiṇam bhāva iti
translated: the wind kasiṇa …🔽the blue kasiṇa …🔽the yellow kasiṇa …🔽the red kasiṇa …

original: pītakasiṇaṁ bhāveti …🔽lohitakasiṇaṁ bhāveti …🔽odātakasiṇaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: pīta kasiṇam bhāva iti  lohita kasiṇam bhāva iti  odāta kasiṇam bhāva iti
translated: the white kasiṇa …🔽the space kasiṇa …

original: ākāsakasiṇaṁ bhāveti …🔽viññāṇakasiṇaṁ bhāveti …. (…)🔽Asubhasaññaṁ bhāveti …🔽maraṇasaññaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: ākāsa kasiṇam bhāva iti  viññāṇa kasiṇam bhāveti  asubha saññam bhāveti  maraṇa saññam bhāveti
translated: the consciousness kasiṇa …🔽They develop the perception of foulness …🔽the perception of death …

original: āhāre paṭikūlasaññaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: āhāre paṭikūla saññam bhāveti
translated: the perception of the repulsiveness of food …

original: sabbaloke anabhiratisaññaṁ bhāveti …🔽aniccasaññaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: sabba loke an abhirati saññam bhāveti  anicca saññam bhāveti
translated: the perception of non-delight in the entire world …🔽the perception of impermanence …

original: anicce dukkhasaññaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: anicce dukkha saññam bhāveti
translated: the perception of suffering in the impermanent …

original: dukkhe anattasaññaṁ bhāveti …🔽pahānasaññaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: dukkhe anatta saññam bhāveti  pahāna saññam bhāveti
translated: He develops the perception of non-self in what is suffering …🔽He develops the perception of abandoning …

original: virāgasaññaṁ bhāveti …🔽nirodhasaññaṁ bhāveti ….
analyzed: virāga saññam bhāveti  nirodha saññam bhāveti
translated: He develops the perception of dispassion …🔽He develops the perception of cessation …

original: Aniccasaññaṁ bhāveti …🔽anattasaññaṁ bhāveti …🔽maraṇasaññaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: anicca saññam bhāveti  anatta saññam bhāveti  maraṇa saññam bhāveti
translated: He develops the perception of inconstancy …🔽He develops the perception of non-self …🔽He develops the perception of death …

original: āhāre paṭikūlasaññaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: āhāre paṭikūla saññam bhāveti
translated: He develops the perception of the unattractive …

original: sabbaloke anabhiratisaññaṁ bhāveti …🔽aṭṭhikasaññaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: sabba loke an abhirati saññam bhāveti  aṭṭhika saññam bhāveti
translated: He develops the perception of danger in all conditioned things …🔽He develops the perception of a bloated corpse …

original: puḷavakasaññaṁ bhāveti …🔽vinīlakasaññaṁ bhāveti …🔽vicchiddakasaññaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: puḷavaka saññam bhāveti  vinīlaka saññam bhāveti  vicchiddaka saññam bhāveti
translated: He develops the perception of a worm-infested corpse …🔽He develops the perception of a livid corpse …🔽He develops the perception of a fissured corpse …

original: uddhumātakasaññaṁ bhāveti ….🔽Buddhānussatiṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: uddhumātaka saññam bhāveti  buddha anussatim bhāveti
translated: He develops the perception of a bloated corpse …🔽He develops the recollection of the Buddha …

original: dhammānussatiṁ bhāveti …🔽saṅghānussatiṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: dhamma anussatim bhāveti  saṅgha anussatim bhāveti
translated: He develops the recollection of the Dhamma …🔽He develops the recollection of the Saṅgha …🔽He develops the recollection of virtue …

original: sīlānussatiṁ bhāveti …🔽cāgānussatiṁ bhāveti …🔽devatānussatiṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: sīla anussatim bhāveti  cāga anussatim bhāveti  devatā anussatim bhāveti
translated: He develops the recollection of generosity …🔽He develops the recollection of deities …🔽He develops mindfulness of breathing …🔽He develops mindfulness of death …

original: ānāpānassatiṁ bhāveti …🔽maraṇassatiṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: āna apānaḥ satim bhāveti  maraṇaḥ satim bhāveti
translated: He develops mindfulness directed to the body …🔽He develops the recollection of peace …🔽He develops the faith faculty …

original: kāyagatāsatiṁ bhāveti …🔽upasamānussatiṁ bhāveti ….🔽Paṭhamajjhānasahagataṁ saddhindriyaṁ bhāveti …🔽vīriyindriyaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: kāya gata asatim bhāva iti 🔽upasama anussatim bhāveti 🔽          🔽vīriyindriyam bhāva iti
translated: He develops the energy faculty …

original: satindriyaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: sati indriyam
translated: He develops the faculty of concentration …

original: samādhindriyaṁ bhāveti …🔽paññindriyaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: samādhi indriyam bhāva iti  paññindriyam bhāveti
translated: He develops the faculty of wisdom …🔽He develops the strength of faith …

original: saddhābalaṁ bhāveti …🔽vīriyabalaṁ bhāveti …🔽satibalaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: saddhā balam bhāva iti  vīriya balam bhāva iti  sati balam bhāva iti
translated: He develops the strength of energy …🔽He develops the strength of mindfulness …

original: samādhibalaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: samādhi balam bhāva iti
translated: He develops the strength of concentration …

original: paññābalaṁ bhāveti ….🔽Dutiyajjhānasahagataṁ …pe…
analyzed: paññā balam bhāveti  dutiya jhāna sahagatam pe
translated: He develops the strength of wisdom …🔽He develops the faculty of faith …

original: tatiyajjhānasahagataṁ …pe…🔽catutthajjhānasahagataṁ …pe…🔽mettāsahagataṁ …pe…🔽karuṇāsahagataṁ …pe…🔽muditāsahagataṁ …pe…🔽upekkhāsahagataṁ saddhindriyaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: tatiya jhāna sahagatam pe  catuttha jhāna sahagatam pe  mettā sahagatam pe  karuṇā sahagatam pe  muditā sahagatam pe  upekkhā sahagatam saddhindriyam bhāveti
translated: He develops the faculty of energy …🔽He develops the faculty of mindfulness …

original: vīriyindriyaṁ bhāveti …🔽satindriyaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: vīriyindriyam bhāva iti  sati indriyam
translated: He develops the faculty of concentration …🔽He develops the faculty of wisdom …

original: samādhindriyaṁ bhāveti …🔽paññindriyaṁ bhāveti …🔽saddhābalaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: samādhi indriyam bhāva iti  paññindriyam bhāveti  saddhā balam bhāva iti
translated: He develops the strength of faith …🔽He develops the strength of energy …

original: vīriyabalaṁ bhāveti …🔽satibalaṁ bhāveti …🔽samādhibalaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: vīriya balam bhāva iti  sati balam bhāva iti  samādhi balam bhāva iti
translated: He develops the strength of mindfulness …🔽He develops the strength of concentration …

original: paññābalaṁ bhāveti.
analyzed: paññā balam bhāveti
translated: He develops the strength of wisdom …

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave:
analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave
translated: This is called

original: ‘bhikkhu arittajjhāno viharati satthusāsanakaro ovādapatikaro, amoghaṁ raṭṭhapiṇḍaṁ bhuñjati’.
analyzed: bhikkhu aritta jhānaḥ viharati satthu sāsana karaḥ ovāda patikaraḥ amogham raṭṭha piṇḍam bhuñjati
translated: a monk who lives having attained the meditation that is noble and surpasses that of ordinary people, who practices in accordance with the Teacher’s instructions and responds to his advice, who does not eat the country’s almsfood in vain.”

original: Ko pana vādo ye naṁ bahulīkarontī”ti.
analyzed: kaḥ pana vādaḥ ye nam bahulīkaronti iti
translated: What more needs to be said about those who develop it?”

original: (Aparaaccharāsaṅghātavaggo.)
analyzed: apara accharā saṅghāta vaggo
translated: (The chapter called “The Single Test of the Rains”)

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 1
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of Elevens

original: 30. Kāyagatāsativagga
analyzed: kāya gata asati vagga
translated: The Chapter on Mindfulness of the Body

original: “Yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo cetasā phuṭo antogadhā tassa kunnadiyo yā kāci samuddaṅgamā;
analyzed: yassa kassaci bhikkhave mahā samuddaḥ cetasā phuṭaḥ antogadhā tassa kunnadiyaḥ yā kāci samudda aṅgamā
translated: “Whoever has the ocean in mind and includes the rivers that flow into it,

original: evamevaṁ, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci kāyagatā sati bhāvitā bahulīkatā antogadhā tassa kusalā dhammā ye keci vijjābhāgiyā”ti.🔽“Ekadhammo, bhikkhave, bhāvito bahulīkato mahato saṁvegāya saṁvattati … mahato atthāya🔽saṁvattati … mahato yogakkhemāya saṁvattati … satisampajaññāya saṁvattati … ñāṇadassanappaṭilābhāya
analyzed: evam eva bhikkhave yassa kassaci kāya gatā sati bhāvitā bahulīkatā antogadhā tassa kusalāḥ dhammāḥ ye keci vijjā bhāgiyā ati  eka dhammaḥ bhikkhave bhāvitaḥ bahulīkataḥ mahataḥ sa vegāya savattati mahato atthāya  savattati mahataḥ yogakkhemāya savattati sati sampajaññāya savattati ñāṇa dassana ppaṭilābhāya
translated: in the same way, whoever has developed and cultivated mindfulness of the body, includes all wholesome qualities that lead to knowledge.”

original: saṁvattati … diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārāya saṁvattati … vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: savattati diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihārāya savattati vijjā vimutti phala sacchikiriyāya savattati
translated: “One thing, monks, when developed and cultivated, leads to great benefit … great security from bondage … great ease in guidance … to mindfulness and clear awareness … to the attainment of knowledge and vision … to blissful abiding in the here-and-now … to the realization of the fruit of knowledge and liberation.

original: Katamo ekadhammo?
analyzed: katamaḥ eka dhammaḥ
translated: What is that one thing?

original: Kāyagatā sati.
analyzed: kāya gatā sati
translated: Mindfulness of the body.

original: Ayaṁ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato mahato saṁvegāya saṁvattati … mahato
analyzed: ayam kho bhikkhave eka dhammaḥ bhāvitaḥ bahulīkataḥ mahataḥ sa vegāya savattati mahataḥ
translated: This is the one thing that, developed and cultivated, leads to great urgency …🔽to great good …🔽to great safety …

original: atthāya saṁvattati … mahato yogakkhemāya saṁvattati … satisampajaññāya saṁvattati
analyzed: atthāya savattati mahataḥ yogakkhemāya savattati sati sampajaññāya savattati
translated: to mindfulness and clear awareness …🔽to the attainment of knowledge and vision …🔽to blissful abiding here and now …

original: … ñāṇadassanappaṭilābhāya saṁvattati … diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārāya saṁvattati … vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyāya saṁvattatī”ti.
analyzed: ñāṇa dassana ppaṭilābhāya savattati diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihārāya savattati  vijjā vimutti phala sacchikiriyāya savattati iti
translated: to the realization of the fruit of knowledge and freedom.”

original: “Ekadhamme, bhikkhave, bhāvite bahulīkate kāyopi passambhati, cittampi passambhati, vitakkavicārāpi vūpasammanti, kevalāpi vijjābhāgiyā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchanti.
analyzed: eka dhamme bhikkhave bhāvite bahulīkate kāyaḥ api passambhati cittam api passambhati vitakka vicārā api vūpasammanti kevalāḥ api vijjā bhāgiyāḥ dhammāḥ bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti
translated: “Bhikkhus, when one thing is developed and cultivated, the body becomes tranquil and the mind becomes tranquil; thinking and pondering subside; and the wholesome states that pertain to knowledge reach fulfilment by development.

original: Katamasmiṁ ekadhamme?
analyzed: katamasmin eka dhamme
translated: What is that one thing?

original: Kāyagatāya satiyā.🔽Imasmiṁ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhamme bhāvite bahulīkate kāyopi passambhati, cittampi
analyzed: kāya gatāya satiyā  imasmin kho bhikkhave eka dhamme bhāvite bahulīkate kāyaḥ api passambhati cittam pi
translated: Mindfulness of the body.

original: passambhati, vitakkavicārāpi vūpasammanti, kevalāpi vijjābhāgiyā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchantī”ti.
analyzed: passambhati vitakka vicārā api vūpasammanti kevalāḥ api vijjā bhāgiyāḥ dhammāḥ bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti iti
translated: When this one thing is developed and cultivated, the body becomes tranquil and the mind becomes tranquil; thinking and pondering subside; and the wholesome states that pertain to knowledge reach fulfilment by development.”

original: “Ekadhamme, bhikkhave, bhāvite bahulīkate anuppannā ceva akusalā dhammā nuppajjanti, uppannā ca akusalā dhammā pahīyanti.
analyzed: eka dhamme bhikkhave bhāvite bahulīkate anuppannā ca iva akusalāḥ dhammāḥ na uppajjanti uppannā ca akusalāḥ dhammāḥ pahīyanti
translated: “When one thing is developed and cultivated, unarisen unwholesome qualities do not arise, and arisen unwholesome qualities are abandoned.

original: Katamasmiṁ ekadhamme?
analyzed: katamasmin eka dhamme
translated: What is that one thing?

original: Kāyagatāya satiyā.
analyzed: kāya gatāya satiyā
translated: Mindfulness of the body.

original: Imasmiṁ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhamme bhāvite bahulīkate anuppannā ceva akusalā dhammā nuppajjanti, uppannā ca akusalā dhammā pahīyantī”ti.
analyzed: imasmin kho bhikkhave eka dhamme bhāvite bahulīkate anuppannā ca iva akusalāḥ dhammāḥ na uppajjanti uppannāḥ ca akusalāḥ dhammāḥ pahīyanti iti
translated: When this one thing is developed and cultivated, unarisen unwholesome qualities do not arise, and arisen unwholesome qualities are abandoned.”

original: “Ekadhamme, bhikkhave, bhāvite bahulīkate anuppannā ceva kusalā dhammā uppajjanti, uppannā ca kusalā dhammā bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṁvattanti.
analyzed: eka dhamme bhikkhave bhāvite bahulīkate anuppannā ca iva kusalāḥ dhammāḥ uppajjanti uppannāḥ ca kusalāḥ dhammāḥ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya savattanti
translated: “When one thing is developed and cultivated, unarisen wholesome qualities arise, and arisen wholesome qualities increase and expand.

original: Katamasmiṁ ekadhamme?
analyzed: katamasmin eka dhamme
translated: What is that one thing?

original: Kāyagatāya satiyā.
analyzed: kāya gatāya satiyā
translated: Mindfulness of the body.

original: Imasmiṁ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhamme bhāvite bahulīkate anuppannā ceva kusalā dhammā uppajjanti, uppannā ca kusalā dhammā bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṁvattantī”ti.
analyzed: imasmin kho bhikkhave eka dhamme bhāvite bahulīkate anuppannā ca iva kusalāḥ dhammāḥ uppajjanti uppannāḥ ca kusalāḥ dhammāḥ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya savattanti iti
translated: When this one thing is developed and cultivated, unarisen wholesome qualities arise, and arisen wholesome qualities increase and expand.”

original: “Ekadhamme, bhikkhave, bhāvite bahulīkate avijjā pahīyati … vijjā uppajjati … asmimāno pahīyati … anusayā samugghātaṁ gacchanti … saṁyojanā pahīyanti.
analyzed: eka dhamme bhikkhave bhāvite bahulīkate avijjā pahīyati vijjā uppajjati asmimānaḥ pahīyati anusayā samugghātam gacchanti sayojanā pahīyanti
translated: “When one thing is developed and cultivated, ignorance is abandoned, understanding arises, the conceit ‘I am’ is abandoned, underlying tendencies are uprooted, and fetters are abandoned.

original: Katamasmiṁ ekadhamme?
analyzed: katamasmin eka dhamme
translated: What is that one thing?

original: Kāyagatāya satiyā.
analyzed: kāya gatāya satiyā
translated: Mindfulness of the body.

original: Imasmiṁ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhamme bhāvite bahulīkate avijjā pahīyati … vijjā uppajjati … asmimāno pahīyati … anusayā samugghātaṁ gacchanti … saṁyojanā pahīyantī”ti.
analyzed: imasmin kho bhikkhave eka dhamme bhāvite bahulīkate avijjā pahīyati vijjā uppajjati asmimānaḥ pahīyati anusayā samugghātam gacchanti sayojanā pahīyanti iti
translated: When this one thing is developed and cultivated, ignorance is abandoned, understanding arises, the conceit ‘I am’ is abandoned, underlying tendencies are uprooted, and fetters are abandoned.”

original: “Ekadhammo, bhikkhave, bhāvito bahulīkato paññāpabhedāya saṁvattati … anupādāparinibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: eka dhammaḥ bhikkhave bhāvitaḥ bahulīkataḥ paññā apabhedāya savattati an upādā parinibbānāya savattati
translated: “One thing, monastics, when developed and cultivated, leads to the discernment of discernment … to the destruction of the pollutants without remainder.

original: Katamo ekadhammo?
analyzed: katamaḥ eka dhammaḥ
translated: What is that one thing?

original: Kāyagatā sati.
analyzed: kāya gatā sati
translated: Mindfulness of the body.

original: Ayaṁ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato paññāpabhedāya saṁvattati … anupādāparinibbānāya saṁvattatī”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho bhikkhave eka dhammaḥ bhāvitaḥ bahulīkataḥ paññā apabhedāya savattati anupādā parinibbānāya savattati iti
translated: This one thing, monastics, when developed and cultivated, leads to the discernment of discernment … to the destruction of the pollutants without remainder.”

original: “Ekadhamme, bhikkhave, bhāvite bahulīkate anekadhātupaṭivedho hoti … nānādhātupaṭivedho hoti … anekadhātupaṭisambhidā hoti.
analyzed: eka dhamme bhikkhave bhāvite bahulīkate aneka dhātu paṭivedhaḥ hoti  nānā dhātu paṭivedhaḥ hoti  aneka dhātu paṭisambhidā hoti
translated: “When one thing is developed and cultivated, the penetration of the variety of elements comes about, the penetration of the variety of elements comes about, the differentiation of the variety of elements comes about.

original: Katamasmiṁ ekadhamme?
analyzed: katamasmin eka dhamme
translated: What is that one thing?

original: Kāyagatāya satiyā.
analyzed: kāya gatāya satiyā
translated: Mindfulness of the body.

original: Imasmiṁ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhamme bhāvite bahulīkate anekadhātupaṭivedho hoti … nānādhātupaṭivedho hoti … anekadhātupaṭisambhidā hotī”ti.
analyzed: imasmin kho bhikkhave eka dhamme bhāvite bahulīkate aneka dhātu paṭivedhaḥ hoti  nānā dhātu paṭivedhaḥ hoti  aneka dhātu paṭisambhidā hoti iti
translated: When this one thing is developed and cultivated, the penetration of the variety of elements comes about, the penetration of the variety of elements comes about, the differentiation of the variety of elements comes about.”

original: “Ekadhammo, bhikkhave, bhāvito bahulīkato sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya saṁvattati
analyzed: eka dhammaḥ bhikkhave bhāvitaḥ bahulīkataḥ sotāpatti phala sacchikiriyāya savattati
translated: “Bhikkhus, when one thing is developed and cultivated, it leads to the realization of the fruit of stream-entry. …

original: … sakadāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya saṁvattati … anāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya saṁvattati
analyzed: sakadāgāmi phala sacchikiriyāya savattati anāgāmi phala sacchikiriyāya savattati
translated: It leads to the realization of the fruit of once-returning. … It leads to the realization of the fruit of non-returning. …

original: … arahattaphalasacchikiriyāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: arahatta phala sacchikiriyāya
translated: It leads to the realization of the fruit of arahantship.

original: Katamo ekadhammo?
analyzed: katamaḥ eka dhammaḥ
translated: What is that one thing?

original: Kāyagatā sati.
analyzed: kāya gatā sati
translated: Mindfulness of the body.

original: Ayaṁ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya saṁvattati
analyzed: ayam kho bhikkhave eka dhammaḥ bhāvitaḥ bahulīkataḥ sotāpatti phala sacchikiriyāya savattati
translated: When this one thing is developed and cultivated, it leads to the realization of the fruit of stream-entry. …

original: … sakadāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya saṁvattati … anāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya saṁvattati
analyzed: sakadāgāmi phala sacchikiriyāya savattati anāgāmi phala sacchikiriyāya savattati
translated: … leads to the realization of the fruit of once-returning …🔽… leads to the realization of the fruit of non-returning …

original: … arahattaphalasacchikiriyāya saṁvattatī”ti.
analyzed: arahatta phala sacchikiriyāya savattati iti
translated: … leads to the realization of the fruit of perfection.”

original: “Ekadhammo, bhikkhave, bhāvito bahulīkato paññāpaṭilābhāya saṁvattati … paññāvuddhiyā
analyzed: eka dhammaḥ bhikkhave bhāvitaḥ bahulīkataḥ paññā paṭilābhāya savattati paññā vuddhiyā
translated: “One thing, monks, when developed and cultivated, leads to the acquisition of wisdom …🔽to the increase of wisdom …🔽to the abundance of wisdom …

original: saṁvattati … paññāvepullāya saṁvattati … mahāpaññatāya saṁvattati … puthupaññatāya🔽saṁvattati … vipulapaññatāya saṁvattati … gambhīrapaññatāya saṁvattati … asāmantapaññatāya
analyzed: savattati paññā vepullāya savattati mahā paññatāya savattati puthu paññatāya  savattati vipula paññatāya savattati gambhīra paññatāya savattati asāmanta paññatāya
translated: to great wisdom … to wide wisdom …🔽to deep wisdom … to penetrative wisdom …🔽to wisdom that is expansive … to wisdom that is quick …

original: saṁvattati … bhūripaññatāya saṁvattati … paññābāhullāya saṁvattati … sīghapaññatāya🔽saṁvattati … lahupaññatāya saṁvattati … hāsapaññatāya saṁvattati … javanapaññatāya
analyzed: savattati bhūri paññatāya savattati paññā bāhullāya savattati sīgha paññatāya  savattati lahu paññatāya savattati hāsa paññatāya savattati javana paññatāya
translated: to wisdom that is swift … to wisdom that is sharp …

original: saṁvattati … tikkhapaññatāya saṁvattati … nibbedhikapaññatāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: savattati tikkha paññatāya savattati nibbedhika paññatāya savattati
translated: to wisdom that is keen … to wisdom that is liberating.

original: Katamo ekadhammo?
analyzed: katamaḥ eka dhammaḥ
translated: What is that one thing?

original: Kāyagatā sati.
analyzed: kāya gatā sati
translated: Mindfulness directed to the body.

original: Ayaṁ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato paññāpaṭilābhāya saṁvattati … paññāvuddhiyā
analyzed: ayam kho bhikkhave eka dhammaḥ bhāvitaḥ bahulīkataḥ paññā paṭilābhāya savattati paññā vuddhiyā
translated: This one dhamma, when developed and cultivated, leads to the acquisition of wisdom,🔽to the increase of wisdom,🔽to the abundance of wisdom,

original: saṁvattati … paññāvepullāya saṁvattati … mahāpaññatāya saṁvattati … puthupaññatāya
analyzed: savattati paññā vepullāya savattati mahā paññatāya savattati puthu paññatāya
translated: to great wisdom,🔽to wide wisdom,🔽to expansive wisdom,🔽to profound wisdom,🔽to wisdom that is emancipating,

original: saṁvattati … vipulapaññatāya saṁvattati … gambhīrapaññatāya saṁvattati … asāmantapaññatāya
analyzed: savattati vipula paññatāya savattati gambhīra paññatāya savattati asāmanta paññatāya
translated: to wisdom that is not limited,🔽to abundant wisdom,

original: saṁvattati … bhūripaññatāya saṁvattati … paññābāhullāya saṁvattati … sīghapaññatāya🔽saṁvattati … lahupaññatāya saṁvattati … hāsapaññatāya saṁvattati … javanapaññatāya
analyzed: savattati bhūri paññatāya savattati paññā bāhullāya savattati sīgha paññatāya  savattati lahu paññatāya savattati hāsa paññatāya savattati javana paññatāya
translated: to quick wisdom,🔽to rapid wisdom,🔽to penetrative wisdom,

original: saṁvattati … tikkhapaññatāya saṁvattati … nibbedhikapaññatāya saṁvattatī”ti.🔽(Kāyagatāsativaggo.)🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 1
analyzed: savattati tikkha paññatāya savattati nibbedhika paññatāya savattati iti  kāya gata asati vaggo  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: to wisdom that is timely.🔽(The Collection on Mindfulness of the Body)🔽The Book of Elevens

original: 31. Amatavagga
analyzed: a mata vagga
translated: The Chapter on the Deathless

original: “Amataṁ te, bhikkhave, na paribhuñjanti ye kāyagatāsatiṁ na paribhuñjanti.
analyzed: amatam te bhikkhave na paribhuñjanti ye kāya gata asatim na paribhuñjanti
translated: “Monks, those who do not enjoy the mindfulness of the body enjoy the unenjoyed supreme enjoyment.

original: Amataṁ te, bhikkhave, paribhuñjanti ye kāyagatāsatiṁ paribhuñjantī”ti.
analyzed: amatam te bhikkhave paribhuñjanti ye kāya gata asatim paribhuñjanti iti
translated: Those who enjoy the mindfulness of the body enjoy the deathless.”

original: “Amataṁ tesaṁ, bhikkhave, aparibhuttaṁ yesaṁ kāyagatāsati aparibhuttā.
analyzed: amatam bhikkhave a paribhuttam yesam kāyagatā asati a paribhuttā
translated: “Monks, those who have not enjoyed the mindfulness of the body have not enjoyed the deathless.

original: Amataṁ tesaṁ, bhikkhave, paribhuttaṁ yesaṁ kāyagatāsati paribhuttā”ti.
analyzed: amatam tesa bhikkhave paribhuttam yesam kāyagatā asati paribhuttā ati
translated: Those who have enjoyed the mindfulness of the body have enjoyed the deathless.”

original: “Amataṁ tesaṁ, bhikkhave, parihīnaṁ yesaṁ kāyagatāsati parihīnā.
analyzed: amatam tesa bhikkhave parihīnam yesam kāyagatā asati parihīnā
translated: “Monks, those who have lost the mindfulness of the body have lost the deathless.

original: Amataṁ tesaṁ, bhikkhave, aparihīnaṁ yesaṁ kāyagatāsati aparihīnā”ti.
analyzed: amatam tesa bhikkhave a parihīnam yesam kāyagatā asati a parihīnā ati
translated: Those who have not lost the mindfulness of the body have not lost the deathless.”

original: “Amataṁ tesaṁ, bhikkhave, viraddhaṁ yesaṁ kāyagatāsati viraddhā.
analyzed: amatam bhikkhave viraddham yesam kāyagatā asati viraddhā
translated: “Monks, those who have lapsed in the mindfulness of the body have lapsed in the deathless.

original: Amataṁ tesaṁ, bhikkhave, āraddhaṁ yesaṁ kāyagatāsati āraddhā”ti.
analyzed: amatam tesa bhikkhave āraddham yesam kāyagatā asati āraddhā ati
translated: Those who have not lapsed in the mindfulness of the body have not lapsed in the deathless.”

original: “Amataṁ te, bhikkhave, pamādiṁsu ye kāyagatāsatiṁ pamādiṁsu.
analyzed: amatam te bhikkhave pamādisu ye kāya gata asatim pamādisu
translated: “Monks, those who have been negligent in the mindfulness of the body have been negligent in the deathless.

original: Amataṁ te, bhikkhave, na pamādiṁsu ye kāyagatāsatiṁ na pamādiṁsu”.
analyzed: amatam te bhikkhave na pamādisu ye kāya gata asatim na pamādisu
translated: Those who have not been negligent in the mindfulness of the body have not been negligent in the deathless.”

original: “Amataṁ tesaṁ, bhikkhave, pamuṭṭhaṁ yesaṁ kāyagatāsati pamuṭṭhā.
analyzed: amatam tesa bhikkhave pamuṭṭham yesam kāya gatā asati pamuṭṭhā
translated: “Monks, those who have been confused about the mindfulness of the body have been confused about the deathless.

original: Amataṁ tesaṁ, bhikkhave, appamuṭṭhaṁ yesaṁ kāyagatāsati appamuṭṭhā”ti.
analyzed: amatam tesa bhikkhave appamuṭṭham yesam kāyagatā asati appamuṭṭhā ati
translated: “Monks, the deathless has not been realized by those for whom mindfulness of the body has not been developed & pursued.”

original: “Amataṁ tesaṁ, bhikkhave, anāsevitaṁ yesaṁ kāyagatāsati anāsevitā.
analyzed: amatam bhikkhave anāsevitam yesam kāyagatā asati anāsevitā
translated: “Monks, the deathless has not been frequented by those for whom mindfulness of the body has not been frequented.

original: Amataṁ tesaṁ, bhikkhave, āsevitaṁ yesaṁ kāyagatāsati āsevitā”ti.
analyzed: amatam tesa bhikkhave āsevitam yesam kāyagatā asatī āsevitā ati
translated: “Monks, the deathless has been frequented by those for whom mindfulness of the body has been frequented.”

original: “Amataṁ tesaṁ, bhikkhave, abhāvitaṁ yesaṁ kāyagatāsati abhāvitā.
analyzed: amatam bhikkhave abhāvitam yesam kāyagatā asati abhāvitā
translated: “Monks, the deathless has not been developed by those for whom mindfulness of the body has not been developed.

original: Amataṁ tesaṁ, bhikkhave, bhāvitaṁ yesaṁ kāyagatāsati bhāvitā”ti.
analyzed: amatam tesa bhikkhave bhāvitam yesam kāyagatā asati bhāvitā ati
translated: “Monks, the deathless has been developed by those for whom mindfulness of the body has been developed.”

original: “Amataṁ tesaṁ, bhikkhave, abahulīkataṁ yesaṁ kāyagatāsati abahulīkatā.
analyzed: amatam bhikkhave a bahulīkatam yesam kāyagatā asati a bahulīkatā
translated: “Monks, the deathless has not been made much of by those for whom mindfulness of the body has not been made much of.

original: Amataṁ tesaṁ, bhikkhave, bahulīkataṁ yesaṁ kāyagatāsati bahulīkatā”ti.
analyzed: amatam tesa bhikkhave bahulīkatam yesam kāyagatā asati bahulīkatā ati
translated: “Monks, the deathless has been made much of by those for whom mindfulness of the body has been made much of.”

original: “Amataṁ tesaṁ, bhikkhave, anabhiññātaṁ yesaṁ kāyagatāsati anabhiññātā.
analyzed: amatam tesa bhikkhave an abhiññātam yesam kāyagatā asati an abhiññātā
translated: “Monks, the deathless has not been directly known by those for whom mindfulness of the body has not been directly known.

original: Amataṁ tesaṁ, bhikkhave, abhiññātaṁ yesaṁ kāyagatāsati abhiññātā”ti.
analyzed: amatam tesa bhikkhave abhiññātam yesam kāya gatā asati abhiññātā ati
translated: “Monks, the deathless has been directly known by those for whom mindfulness of the body has been directly known.”

original: “Amataṁ tesaṁ, bhikkhave, apariññātaṁ yesaṁ kāyagatāsati apariññātā.
analyzed: amatam tesa bhikkhave apariññātam yesam kāyagatā asati apariññātā
translated: “Monks, the deathless has not been fully known by those for whom mindfulness of the body has not been fully known.

original: Amataṁ tesaṁ, bhikkhave, pariññātaṁ yesaṁ kāyagatāsati pariññātā”ti.
analyzed: amatam tesa bhikkhave pariññātam yesam kāyagatā asati pariññātā ati
translated: “Monks, the deathless has been fully understood by those who have fully understood the body as a body.”

original: “Amataṁ tesaṁ, bhikkhave, asacchikataṁ yesaṁ kāyagatāsati asacchikatā.
analyzed: amatam tesa bhikkhave a sacchikatam yesam kāyagatā asati a sacchikatā
translated: “Monks, the deathless has not been realized by those who have not realized the body as a body.

original: Amataṁ tesaṁ, bhikkhave, sacchikataṁ yesaṁ kāyagatāsati sacchikatā”ti.
analyzed: amatam tesa bhikkhave sacchikatam yesam kāyagatā asati sacchikatā ati
translated: “Monks, the deathless has been realized by those who have realized the body as a body.”

original: Idamavoca bhagavā.
analyzed: idam avoca bhagavān
translated: That is what the Blessed One said.

original: Attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandunti.
analyzed: attamanāḥ te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinandunti
translated: Pleased, the monks were satisfied with the Blessed One’s words.

original: (Amatavaggo.)
analyzed: a mata vaggaḥ
translated: (The Section on the Deathless)

original: Ekakanipātapāḷi niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: niṭṭhitā
translated: The first section is finished.
